The bill arrived and we left a meager tip (under 50 cents, if memory serves) along with a note: "Be nice and you'll get better tips. :( PS- We saw the avocado." Sure, it was mean and vindictive, but oh so true. Looking like you don't want to serve your customers makes them feel like tipping you is optional. Epilogue: Phew, Review 200 has been officially knocked off, no more pressure, woo!
Sadly, CPK is no longer offering GF pizza... going down a star for that move. Salads are still a solid choice, but sometimes a girl just wants to enjoy some pizza with everyone else!

For a CPK it is a pretty nice one.  Conveniently located in the Prudential Center.  Though this makes it quite packed as well, with there usually being a wait.  The downside is they always seem busy, so a waiter can be hard to get a hold of at times. Though the food was delivered fast and correctly.  We never felt hurried to eat and leave even with the crowd.  The pizza they have and the variety is quite impressive and they will have something that everyone should like. If you are looking for a nice sit-down pizza restaurant this is a good choice.

We went last night for a lateish dinner when my parents arrived in town. Wanting something inside the mall (it was POURING) and with quick service, we stopped here and found out it was a 10 minute wait. Pretty good for a Friday night! We got sat really fast and our waiter was awesome - patient, funny, helpful. We ended up sharing the The Original BBQ Chicken Chopped (Chopped lettuce, black beans, sweet corn, jicama, cilantro, basil, crispy corn tortilla strips and Monterey Jack cheese tossed together in herb ranch dressing - we got the balsamic and the ranch on the side. Topped with chopped BBQ chicken breast, diced tomatoes and green onions) and the Chinese Chicken Salad (Shredded Napa cabbage, crisp iceberg and crispy wontons tossed with julienne carrots, red cabbage, green onions, toasted sesame seeds and fresh cilantro in a spicy sweet & sour sesame dressing. Topped with chilled-grilled chicken breast). We liked the BBQ better, but both were great. For our main course, we shared the Roasted Garlic Chicken pizza (Roasted garlic, grilled chicken, Mozzarella cheese, mild onions and Italian parsley with a white wine and garlic-shallot butter sauce) which was quite tasty, but was not as good as the Thin Crust Pepperoni Supremo (Italian Pomodoro sauce with pepperoni, Mozzarella, Parmesan and fresh Mozzarella cheeses. Topped with fresh herbs). This was by far the favorite of the table! We didn't get any bread, but we didn't need it. For 4 people, this was a great meal and we were pretty full after! It is a chain and it may not be as good as some of the more "authentic" pizza places, but we thought it was pretty darn good! Totally hit the spot.
Good service. Too much cheese on pizza though. Crispy Mac n cheese was just ok

The Prudential CPK is a good one, as far as CPKs go.   Be prepared for a looooong line on the weekends when mall traffic brings diners in by the heaping handful.   However, you'll be served rapidly and your food won't disappoint.  I've personally found that the less toppings on your pizza that you order the better, but you will likely be happy with whatever you get.
Great food, at a pretty reasonable price. Me and a couple of friends went here tonight for some food.  I got the CPK Cobb Salad - Great.  I'd recommend it to anyone.

The food here is good.  My only complaint is that they need more vacuums.  Or, parents need to teach their toddlers not to spill crumbs all over the floor. Seriously, there are pizza toppings and croutons all over the floor every time I go.

My family and I visited on a recent busy Friday night. We received excellent service, great pizza,  fresh salads, apps and kids meals. Very pleasantly surprised for a national chain, that seemed beyond the ordinary.

One of my all time not favorite chains. The food here is mediocre when compared to other chain restaurants and I'm not the only one who thinks so. CPK makes the Cheesecake Factory look amazing, in my opinion. CPK serves up the same kind of food, but lacking in quantity and quality. When I eat at Cheesecake Factory, I can get a dish with no starches (a salad, a soup) and leave incredibly full and sometimes, with leftovers! I've ordered burgers and pizzas at CPK and left hungry after eating everything on my plate. Now, their food isn't HORRIBLE, but I'd say in comparison to other chains, they're beat in more ways than one.  Example: Thai Lettuce Wraps: one of my favorite appetizers to order as an entree. Cheesecake? One of those and I can barely inhale. CPK? I need to order an app to eat before my entree comes out. Maybe you're thinking that my stomach was in a different condition on each of those days. You're right, it was. I was hungrier when I went to Cheesecake, but left more satisfied with more money in my pocket. So what do you think of that? Anyways, it's just in my opinion that CPK loses to nearly all chains. I always leave there dissatisfied and still hungry and always wonder where my money goes every time.

I love CPK, there isn't any in Cambridge that I am aware of so when I do go to the CPK in the Prudential Mall is a real treat because the pizza is great. They are a good size as well which is great for me because I normally never get full from a personal size pizza. The menu has everything traditionally expected on a pizza and things you wouldn't expect.  I rec. the Hawaiian pizza because not many places can pull it off well and CPK has done a good job with it. There is usually a wait but nothing unbearable and the servers are very nice.  The last pizza I ordered wasn't bad or anything but it was the apple something something and it had lettuce and mayo and I hate mayo ( I should have read the full description) so I didn't enjoy it but the good thing about going with friends you guys can share.

Good quick service.  Excellent pizza selection.  Okay Pot stickers (What was I expecting from a California pizza joint).  Nothing memorable to say here. Not really a impress your date kinda place, but if you are going for pizza and a movie... Perfect.

I wish I could give my dining experience at this restaurant zero stars. I went to this place for lunch with 5 girlfriends. We were seated quickly and that's when the fun times ended. The waitress though pleasant, did not have her act together. First it took about 10 minutes for us to get waters. Then it took about 3o minutes for the first of our sandwiches/personal pizzas/soup/salads to arrive and there was at least a 15 minute gap between when the first of us and last of us was served our main meal. Also, she must have thought that the word  "tortilla"  sounded like "asparagus" because instead of the warm bowl of Mexican soup I was expected, I was instead presented with an oddly green steaming concoction. Not usually a big deal, but by this point all I could think of was "come on already!". The food itself was not prepared the way we requested it. The kitchen decided that my friend asking for no cheese on her pizza meant that they could still top it with "queso" sauce......I ordered the Tuscan Salad off of the small cravings menu and it was gross. The cannelli  beans were mealy and the dressing tasted like straight flavorless oil. 6 dollars for a cup of untastey veggies? never again.  The tortilla soup(when it finally arrived) was flavorless, and reminded me of cardboard. The closest thing I can compare it to would be slightly cheesy cream of wheat. So yeah, I won't be going back to CPK anytime soon. Lunch Fail.

Saying that you want to come to CPK for good pizza is like saying you want to go to McDonald's for a good burger.  It just doesn't make sense. I admit, I used to like CPK.  They had some good BBQ chicken pizza.  But that was before I knew what good pizza is.  I mean, OK, it's not the worst restaurant at the Pru, but I don't understand why there is always a 3 hour wait for this place.  It's all those damn tourists!  I think they have forgotten that CPK is a chain....or, they KNOW it is a chain and are too scared to go outside of a 1 mile radius from their hotel. The service is ALWAYS slow.  I've been here a handful of times, and every time, I feel like the meal takes 3 hours.  And the servers are kind of clueless.  Basically, at least TRY to walk outside of the Pru in order to get some good food....

I love the pizzas at CPK, and the service is usually very good. This CPK in particular made me laugh until my BBQ chicken pizza nearly came out of my nose. I was sitting at my table with my friend Melis, eating my pizza while she had her soup. Suddenly, out of the corner of my eye, I saw something streak across the floor right past our table. At first I thought it was the glint of someone's jewelry reflecting on my glasses, but when I turned around to look at the gray streak of lighting, it actually turned out to be a mouse. Certainly, that is no laughing matter. A mouse in a restaurant? You may as well have a can of Raid at every table sitting next to the salt & pepper! That mouse had jetted across the floor of a VERY crowded restaurant located in a MALL on a FRIDAY NIGHT. And NO ONE saw it. Serious bravado. I caught the attention of a passing waitress. "I don't mean to cause any alarm or anything," I began to say, "but I just saw something..." "Oh," she cut me off, "Was it the mouse?" I paused for a moment and hissed, "What do you mean THE mouse??" That's right. They knew about the mouse. She told me that they're right above the Green line, and sometimes the mouse turns up... but she assured me that it's harmless and that the kitchen is squeaky clean. At first I was incredulous. I could not fathom this. CPK has a pet mouse! Soon after we left, Melis and I just couldn't stop laughing at the whole thing. I have said nearly nothing about CPK itself, although I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this chain (other than this little mascot they have running around). Their pizzas are great, their salads are awesome, and the venue is always clean. And even though I saw a mouse in this restaurant with my own eyes, I still eat there because the food is just so damn good. Yes, my taste buds may need some fine-tuning, but that's just me. Talk about a brand positioning success - even though there's a mouse in the equation, I still prefer CPK over Pizza Hut. :)

Where to begin, well to start off I have been to this location of California Pizza Kitchen four times before. Previously they've been great.  On Monday night (11/25/08) my brother and I decided to grab some dinner here after shopping. The place wasn't packed at all with empty tables everywhere (half the restaurant was empty).  Yet the hostess told us there would be a 20 minutes wait. We asked for a medium or large booth (not a small one).  We asked nicely what the reason for the wait was (due to the very apparent emptiness) she replied that they only had 3 waiters and were understaffed. We said okay and asked her if we had to wait or if we could go browse the shops and come back in 15 minutes). She said "Yes that's fine but be back in 20 minutes not 15. We found her reply a bit abrasive but ignored it. We came back 20 minutes later and they were packed (every table). Not only that but she said they had a medium booth open but it was just taken and now we would have to wait 30 (more) minutes unless we wanted to take a small both. My brother was rather upset and wanted to leave to go to Cheese Cake Factory but I calmed him down and said let's just take the small booth (I should have trusted his instincts and left). Now to the fun. The small booths at this place, keep in mind my brother and I aren't big guys we're both 5'10" - 5' 11" and are average weight for our height. These small booths were made for stick figures. There's no way to be comfortable in them. Add to that the table can barely hold the plates the serve due to the width. Not only that but the small booth they sat us at was right in middle of the high traffic error and at the mid-height wall next to us we the waiters register/station was there. So while we were chatting/eating we'd constantly have a waiter staring at us from the other side of the mid-height wall next to the booth. Now that we have the bad seating of this restaurant out of the way to the good stuff...not... So we get our appetizer and enjoy it (they have decent food in my opinion).Before we can finish our appetizer our waiter brings out our entrees (huge no no when waiting ones table in my opinion). So we're eating our entrees and we're half way done, then the waiter comes to the table and says having desserts guys? My brother replies "most likely but we're still eating our food" the waiter replied "I'll come back in a few".  We finish our food and the waiter brings us our check. My brother is extremely upset as am I due to the fact that the waiter knew we wanted dessert. So we finally get the waiters attention and ask for the dessert menu. He lives and we start looking over the dessert menu. We know what we're getting and wait for the waiter to come back. As we're waiting from underneath our booth two cockroaches come crawling up the wall. YES that's right cockroaches! I nearly throw up but decided to just up and leave the restaurant. We didn't make a scene my brother waited at the table quietly for the manager. 10 minutes go by and the manager doesn't show. The hostess walks by and says to my brother "Did you enjoy your meal?" He pointed at one of the roaches and she took one of our used napkins and killed one of them (the other had gone somewhere else by that time). The manager told my brother in not so many words 'What can we do to make up for this and keep it quiet?' End result being we got our meal free (which didn't make up for anything to me). I felt bad for everyone eating in that restaurant at that time if they knew surely they'd all leave. Now that I think back on it maybe we should have made a scene out of respect for everyone else.  To end this review that was all of the bad. The good was our waiter was very friendly he just seemed inexperienced. Also the food was decent but makes me sick thinking of the roaches.  I'd like to warn everyone to stay away for this location of California Pizza Kitchen at all costs.

Meh... The food: Decent but not memorable The service: adequate but not commendable The place: clean but not fashionable (college dining hall-ish) The price: fair and reasonable The wait: short and manageable  Coming back? Maybe but not probable

Had a nice Thai Chicken pizza here for lunch today, with great service. I get why people rip CPK. It has gourmet pretensions with chain restaurant cooking. It's not authentic thin crust pizza, whatever. But it's tasty, original, and not too heavy. Unlike Bertucci's, Uno's, and Cheesecake Factory, I don't feel ill afterwards. I would stick to the original sauce/topping combos, though, and avoid regular tomato/meat pizzas - they don't compare well with great traditional pizza restaurants.

I seriously love this place.  I actually usually get the same thing whenever I go, the Thai lettuce wraps and the BLT pizza. I've had lettuce wraps everywhere possible, and these are the best I've had in awhile, they aren't too spicy either.  And even though I know the cheesecake factory gives a bigger portion, these win hands down. And yeah, you have to be brave to order lettuce on a pizza, but trust me its worth the risk.  It tastes exactly like the sandwich, but a whole lot better.

I joined this site just to give this restaurant a bad review. We went in with a coupon for a free app. before we realized it had to be used at a different specific location. Oh well, right? We still got an app. ($5 for a big piece of cheesebread) and we ordered two pizzas because we noticed the people next two us each ordered a pizza. Shrimp Scampi Pizza and Sausage and Peppers Pizza....both on Honey Wheat Bread. Olive Garden has better pizza and a better price and they give you free bread and salad with your meal. Service was slow although the restaurant was dead. Don't go here, just save yourself $20 and go eat down the street somewhere else like a real college kid on a budget. I think people go here to spend more money on purpose, because spending any less for pizza would be too pedestrian or something. First and last time I have a craving for trying CPK. Die CPK, just die.  Final damage....$35 after tip for two pizzas, app and waters.

This particular branch restaurant is very conveniently located inside the Copley mall right next to the bridge across Mariott Hotel side. The food is well-controlled and taste about the same as the other branch on Stuart st. between Wang Center and the common.But I find their food taste a bit shallow and very sweet.  What I find awkward is the young diners, who are mainly dressed like they are sitting there dying to be displayed. You will have to see it yourself to find lots of people wearing hats and sunglasses while eating, i.e. Men with tight jeans showing the bulging tummies, girls chatting on the phone till they leave. The next drawback is the waiting service. In general, the food is served extremely slow and it can take 1-1.5 hours to sit and have a quick lunch. I advise that  ordering appetizers definitely slows down the next course.  Personally, we had a bad waitress who did not get us a menu for first 15 min. and the drinks were delivered after another 20 min. And, appetizer was served for another 40 minutes later.  When we were leaving without leaving any tip for her, she confronted us at the door poking my back with the receipt plate. And I had to have a good talk with the manager about the slow service and mostly the rudeness I experienced from that waitress. Whether it was the waitress's negligence or the kitchen forgetting the orders, it was never explained to us and the waitress knew we were not happy, yet still confronting us for not leaving any tip or expediting the service. I stopped going there because of that incident, plus, the menu is barely changed and because the food tastes like take out Chinese cooked with any combination of 5 sauces and 4 different meats. It is not so pleasing diner out place but the location is ideal during the shopping spree in the copley mall, And, the food price is cheap.

I spent the past few days at a conference at the Copley Marriott; stopped here for lunch after browsing their salad menu. I ordered the Miso salad and really enjoyed it; lots of gingery flavor in the dressing, lots of edamame, crunchy noodle bits of some sort.  Service was fine and I made it back to the conference on time.

I was staying at The Mirage when CPK opened in 95 or 96, and I remembered thinking "what a cool place" Sadly, I am thinking" what the heck happened"...The answer is simple when a semi iconic brand expands some of the authenticity dissolves with it.  Like Coors. The restaurant and food are now just average.  To be fair, I had a salad, which was ok.  I have not eaten their signature pizza.  Legendary this place is not....

Nothing spectacular about this chain pizza joint.  Exactly what one would expect:  generic decor, waiters uniformed in a way to make the place seem fancier, a bar.  The food was fine, nothing to get too excited about.  My friend and I split the wild mushroom pizza and the BBQ chicken and applewood smoked bacon pizza.  Both were great, though for me, it's hard to mess both those types of pizza up.  Our waiter was friendly and attentive; he initially brought out the wrong drink for my friend, but almost immediately corrected himself, which earned him major points from me.  Everything was fairly fast and easy.  I wouldn't mind going back.

Normally, I am not a fan of chain restaurants (except Chipotle). However, after taking a break from shopping and devouring the new Cedar Plank Salmon with corn salsa, I had to out myself as a new CPK fan. Sure, this dish is a bit more expensive compared to CPK's standard bland chain restaurant fair, but the cedar plank salmon is both rich with flavor and healthy - the perfect quick meal. Definitely try it the next time you're there and let me know what you think.

The staff here is really nice. I have to give them props, I came in wearing my Yankees shirt and they goofed with me, but provided great service. Apparently, the poor girl who had to serve me lost a game of rock paper scissors as to who would serve the Yankees fan. The outside section is a nice change of pace when it's nice weather. It's next to the mall, but it's not near traffic, so it's pretty secluded to guarantee a nice meal. As I've said in other CPK reviews, have your pizza on the honey wheat crust! YUMMY! Our food was served sorta slowly, but not so slow as to complain. If you're not in a rush, this is great. If you're looking for an in-and-out type deal, try Chili's in the mall across the street in the Marriott.

Not my type of pizza. Overly pretentious, they try too hard with the different types of pizza w/flavors from different continents. The pasta is really starchy and dry, even with sauce on. Wait, in fact, it's gummy. The only thing worth getting here is the salad. One of my all-time favorite salads is their "Original Chopped BBQ Chicken Salad". Shredded romaine, black bean, corn, diced jicama, tortilla chips, sprinkle of cheese and the best garlicky ranch dressing ever! The Asian Chicken salad ain't so bad either.

Ugh, why would you eat at this place with so many better choices in town? Eating pizza with a knife and fork and so much salad on top seems counter to the point of eating pizza for me but if you are looking for a clean sit-down place to take your out-of-town parents and you don't want to expose them to the great unwashed of Boston then this is the place for you. Tablecloths! Waiters! It's even in a mall. Sheesh, why come to Boston if you just want to mall it? Food is actually good for what it is. It just doesn't excite me. Try heading INTO the city for something other than standard fare. Okay, if you just need to fuel the machine but it's just pizza trying to be interesting.

CPK. CPK. What the hell happened? When I first came to Boston, CPK was decent competition for other Pru eateries like Chili's. Now all of a sudden their pizzas are 1/2 the size with 1/2 the toppings. And for nearly double the price (like $13-$14 for a tiny pizza). Are you freaking serious CPK?

I've always thought of CPK as a good chain restaurant. Mostly because of the variety of pizzas and entree salads the menu offers. However, that about speaks for all of it. The service can be spotty, but the food is almost always the same (which is a good thing). It's a good place to rely on in case you're other plans fall through.
subpar pizza. you can find better places in boston for pizza.

I know this is a chain.   I happen to really enjoy the food here.  The atmosphere is fun and casual an upbeat.  Some of my favorite foods-- smoked bacon and gorgongola chopped salad, the thai salad and pretty much all of their burgers, thai linguini and the chipotle chopped salad

Nice pizza ! I had White pizza and my friend had chicken pizza with BBQ sauce. Both were very good ! People who work there were very nice. I could see many people ordered salads so I'd love to try that when I go there again.

I've been here twice recently. I've come to the following conclusion. UNOs is way better and cheaper if you want a chain pizza. You can order online and get 2 flatbreads at UNOs for the price of 1 at CPK. I actually think they are better too. The first time I went to cpk was for lunch and our waiter was terrific. The second time I went was for dinner and our waitress was absolutely terrible. It was apparent she didn't want to be at work or was having a bad day. Management should have cut her.

No. Just, no. When I was visiting my older sister in Boston she took us out to lunch and decided on California Pizza Kitchen. We were seated quickly, and the restaurant was a nice place but the serve was sarcastic and although I suspect he was trying to be funny, failed miserably. We waited quite a bit for our water. Yes, water. And then we ordered some pizza, salad, etc. As I was drinking my water I looked down to see things floating in it. My first thought: Ew, did they wash this glass? Then I saw it. A spider. Floating around. I think it took about five years off my lifespan. My waiter took quite a bit of time to notice my hand in the air, and when I said "there's a spider in my water" he answered "I put it there just for you." Yeah, okay, his tone was just obnoxious.  I will admit the manager was very kind and apologized, she gave us a free appetizer and a bottle of water. Then the water came back with plates, and there was one plate that my sister was able to wipe off a whole load of gunk with her napkin. Hm...do they wash their dishes there? So we got a new one, and our serve admitted we were not having good luck. The food finally came, and my two sisters were sitting across from each other and sharing a salad. My older sister had just put the first bite into her mouth and started chewing when my little sister was like, "Look, a hair!" Sure enough, there was a curly black hair that had come along for the ride. Lovely. I raised my hand once again and waited for the server, whose response was "you're kidding, right?" The manager came back and apologized once again, saying nothing like this had ever happened before. Yeah, right. We left, without eating, at least we didn't have to pay for the food. (Although we would have been extremely angry if we had been expected to.) That experience effectively killed our appetites and any chance that I will ever be returning. I should've just gotten a hot dog.

Though this place can get pretty crowded, their service is excellent, and quick, so wait times are not that long. Their waitstaff are really nice, and pretty, which is always a plus, and the food is good. Not gourmet but good American-Italian cuisine nonetheless.

*My take-out experience* I decided I was going to order some take-out from CPK because my fiance loves this one particular salad there and wanted to do something nice for him for dinner. Big mistake. I ordered the roasted vegetable salad with chicken, a cpk kobb salad, and a meat cravers pizza. I was told it would be prepared in 20 minutes. When I returned in 20 minutes the woman (who was not at the take out window every-time I showed up) told me she was just waiting for the vegetables for the salad.  Another 25 minutes went by until I got my food. 45 minutes later, after ordering, I got a wonderful cobb salad (the only redeemer) , a very cold undercooked pizza, and a roasted vegetable salad that had 4 stips, roughly a quarter of a chicken breast, which was also cold.  So I totally get the up charge at restaurants, BUT that $4 chicken add on could have bought 5 chicken breasts at a grocery store. Honestly, I even photographed it because I thought it was that absurd.  I paid almost $50 for a long wait, cold food, and tiny portions. To say I am disgusted is an understatement and will certainly not return for take-out.
AMAZING! Great service, great food, great experience. Get the avocado club spring roll! You will be craving it for days to come

I really do love their pizza. Yeah yeah I know it's a chain and all but it is really good. I think they have really creative ideas for pizza. Last time I went I got the pear, walnut, and gorgonzola cheese pizza. Despite how odd the ingredients sounded it was SO good. I even went so far as to attempt making it at home (didn't turn out so well). Lots of options to please anyone and the prices are moderate. You usually have a little leftover for lunch the next day or a late night snack.

Ambience: Located in the Prudential Shopping Mall, it is a decent spot to dine and shop. I like the modern look and basic bar setting. There isn't much flashiness to the whole restaurant, but it is clean and comfortable, which counts for something. Service: Our waiter was nice and the service was pretty quick between taking our orders and delivering on said orders.  Food: My table ordered the buffalo cauliflowers, spring rolls of different varieties and I personal got a large cobb salad. The buffalo cauliflower was delicious, mostly due to the tangy sauce. I felt the spring rolls were decent, however I wouldn't order them again. Lastly, the cobb salad was huge, fresh and tasty. I like the large portion of avocado and chicken.  Overall Rating: Overall this place earns 3 out of 5 stars. I was not blown away by this place, but did enjoy my meal. I think the atmosphere was overall average, service again average and food pretty good. I would recommend to try this place since it's relatively affordable and provides quite the variety.

Where do I begin?  We were set to come in here after the Jimmy Fund Walk, we had a party of 11 and Rafael was nice enough to accommodate everything for our party as we arrived. We sat and our troubles began when we were introduced to Charolette.  First off, it's quite clear she lacked the personality and work ethic to even be in on a Sunday afternoon. She seemed incredibly slow and confused the entire time she took simple drink orders. The drinks arrived late and unorganized, some missing ingredients even! The food arrived with the drinks, we sat around as they did nothing and continued to talk amongst themselves. I get it, it's a Sunday, you don't wanna be here, but really? The food was even horrible quality, the halibut was undercooked, the foods with dairy allergies had dairy! Charlotte seemed incredibly uninterested and even to protect herself brought out the slip to show proof she requested it the correct way. What good does that do for me? The waitress or waiter is supposed to let the kitchen know it's wrong and immediately solve it. Not sit in front of the person and say oh I'm sorry, want something else?  We waited forever to simply eat and enjoy after a long committed walk. The general vibe of this place was just lazy and their employees clearly not invested in a job at all. Several people need employment, why stay where you're miserable? You're only making the experience awful for the proprietors.  My suggestion is regardless of the day of the week, hire servers who look and act like they're alive; not dreary, undetermined or disconnected from reality. Charlotte was just insufferable, half asleep and not even empathetic. She just was a mumbling girl that attempted to serve us food that sadly was not edible. Suffice it to say, we left happily and most certainly won't be returning.

I have been to many different CPK restaurants and this one is by far the worst service I have had. I went on a Friday at 2pm and it wasn't busy. I was seated right away. After 20 minutes no one had approached us and we didn't even know who our waiter was. So I flagged down another server and asked if we could have a waiter and they said sure. 10 minutes later another waiter came and asked for our drinks, she ran away while I was ordering and so apparently didn't hear about my appetizer order.  10 minutes later we got our drinks from someone else and we told her we were ready to order food. A few minutes later our waiter came back and we ordered. I ordered the appetizer again (flatbread) with my pizza and told her to just bring things out as soon as they were ready because at this point we were there for 45+ minutes for lunch.  The pizza came in a reasonable amount of time after that but no one refilled our drinks (water or soda). One of my friends got the fish tacos and stopped eating after a few bites because he became nauseated. My pizza was overcooked (burned) but edible. Certainly not as good as the other 5-6 CPK locations I had been to previously.  My appetizer never came.  Basically I'm never coming here again

Rounding up from a 3.5/5. I had a $50 gift card to CPK burning in my pocket for well over a year so I figured why not head over and claim my free lunch? The Boy and I started our meal with Baja Chicken Tortilla Rolls. These were just meh. Really would serve the dish well if it was served with salsa or sour cream instead of just guacamole. We also shared an order of Szechwan Chicken Dumplings. These were tasty as all hell for dumplings; however, wouldn't call them szechuan, they're not spicy at all. Also they were stingy with the delicious sauce. As aghast as the Boy was (and subsequently my sister later when I told my sister about this meal), I ordered the Kung Pao Spaghetti. with Shrimp Similar to the dumplings, this dish was tasty - nowhere near authentic and also lacking in spice even though there are red hot chiles in this dish. Overall, the meal was decent and we didn't have any issues with service as stated with other reviews. Tasty for sure but don't go in expecting a meal equivalent of a 4-star steakhouse. It's frickin' the chain restaurant CPK.

Worst bar service I've ever received in 5 years of visiting the US and 4th visit to Boston. Known for its warm people and great hospitality I was bitterly disappointed. Barman didn't acknowledge us once and threw down our food and cheque.

Ever seen a bunch of first-time offenders spearing garbage on the highway?  They have humiliation dripping from their foreheads and a puss on them like a dead cat.  They won't make eye contact and they don't so much spear as stab.  A lot of them struggle with even this concept. Their second round of community service was, without a doubt, to be servers at the California Pizza Kitchen in Prudential Center. When I asked for a table for four, I awoke the hostess from a deep slumber.  Annoyed at being startled out of her sleep, she grabbed four menus like they had murdered her parents and walked to the table quietly and fast.  She was gone in a wisp of smoke before we even sat down.  She said nothing in reply to our thank yous. We were early and the other couple we were meeting was still twenty minutes away.  It took fifteen minutes for a server who looked like he had smoked every ounce of ganja in the Caribbean to amble over.  We placed drink orders and I really wanted to place a food order in case he wandered out and forgot where he worked but our friends were still parking. As I watched him walk away, I felt like you do when you run up to the check-in counter at the airport and see the "GATE CLOSED" sign in red on the monitor. It took almost another ten minutes after our friends arrived for this dude to come back.  We finally got to place our food orders.  Judging by the items available on the menu, CPK is to pizza what Olive Garden is to pasta.  Hooded in the cloak of Italian cuisine, both restaurants boast one type of dish as their pride and joy and, a little less proudly, also offer other common Italian fare. I got two toppings on each half of my pizza: Roasted garlic chicken on one half and mushroom pepperoni sausage on the other.  I also had a bite of the carne asada. I'd like to say something about steak on pizzas . . .  I love 'Everybody Loves Raymond.'  It's pure genius.  When Brad Garrett's character finally gets married and is taking his vows, the mom stands up to make a comment, to everyone's shock and no one's surprise.  That's what steak is like on a pizza.  Like Marie Barone, steak is a force to be reckoned with and a full meal on its own terms.  A pizza already has cheese, vegetables, and a crust.  It's Robert's wedding and it doesn't need steak to make it better.   All steak does is trample all over the wedding ceremony.  Avoid the carne asada. Get the mushroom pepperoni sausage instead.  The chunks of sausage are huge, three times bigger than the fingernail-sized pieces you find on most pizzas, and the pepperoni is pure fatty, crisp yet chewy tonguegasm.  I don't even remember if there was cheese.  I don't think it needs cheese.  The meat is enough. The roasted garlic chicken was like the ugly friend of a hot person.  Next to the pepperoni, it was a 4 at best.  Want to guess what the problem was?  You got it: Not enough salt.  I would suggest generously salting the onions while you caramelize them.  Salt releases the natural juices of the onions and makes them even more flavorful.  Then, it combines with the juices to build the flavor of the onions to the very best it can be. That's all the salt the roasted garlic chicken needs.  The mozzarella was okay and the chicken just about got away with having no seasoning so this dish could be improved just by salting the onions.  But it could be even better if CPK got a really good char on the chicken.  Salt and char will ALWAYS make your food taste better. And don't talk to me about the "link" between the substances in charred meat and cancer.  There is always a study that shows a "link" and people think it's a hard-and-fast rule.  If I tried hard enough, I could show you a correlation between the thickness of nose hair and the size of your balls. Enough paranoia.  Live, love, fuck, char. While we're on this subject, ignore CPK's calorie information next to their menu items.  If you're eating at CPK, chances are you're not on a diet prescribed by Dr. Nowzaradan.  Just order anything with pepperoni or sausage on it, avoid everything else, and remember to pencil "stair master" into your to-do list for the next day. Done.

The service is abysmal. My fiance and I decided to eat here right before we drove back home from Boston.  They have GF pizza, which is awesome.  I have enjoyed CPK many times in the past, but had not been back in several years. Long story short - I ordered a gf pizza and my fiance ordered a salad.  That's it, nothing else.  From the time we arrived, until the time we left, 2 hours had elapsed!!  Seriously!  Partly they messed up my GF pizza, so they had to re-do it, and partly, they are just damn slow.   Our server was running around taking orders and delivering food to tables.  It was just too much.  So he would disappear for long stretches. We both enjoyed the food, but please go elsewhere if you don't want to sit here for 2+ hours for a pizza and salad.
Food: okay pizza for the price, small portion and thin crust Ambience: nice modern vibe Service: average Passable food for a hungry person who does not want to travel further.

I love this place it's amazing! Really love the rasberry ice tea with extra syrup! The apps and the entrees are really good  Definitely try the salted caramel puddings dessert its so good but not too sweet

The food is so good Gracias  Qualitee piza for a great prise . Good lemonades and taystee appetizers. I like the avocado spring rolls, they were top notch quality. I recommend coming here if your in Boston. They bring the food on time unlike ralphies. De nada

I just love CPK! Definitely one of my favorite places to eat! Their chipotle chicken pizza is delicious and very different, nothing like you'd get anywhere else. Besides that they have some really nice pasta dishes as well. If there's anything you have to try here it's their butter cake dessert. Favorite dessert of all time, it's the best thing ever! The service and ambience is quite nice too, pretty convenient that's located right in prudential too.
We wanted to get the bill and I waved to the waiter. He literally passed by me and didn't even look at me! How rude! ‍‍

I'm in town for a vacation. I go to cpk since it's convenient and right across from my hotel. We walk in , and see the hostess sitting in the corner on her phone. She takes us back to a table that already had a tray with water on it. She picks up the tray but the table is still wet. My 5 year old notices the table is wet and she says out loud, "mommy the table is wet" . I tell my daughter "it's ok baby they will wipe it dry". The hostess tells me "it's just water" and tries to put my menu on top of the water . I grabbed the menu before she could get it wet . This is completely unacceptable . I have never been treated so rudely by a hostess before. Will never come back to this establishment again
Decor is ok, could do with an update. Staff attitude is not good. Need more training. They don't know what artificial sweetener is!!!!! Food is nice though!

Terrible service. The waiter was rude. He did not smile, nor did his face show any expression. He didn't bring bread for us. When I asked him, he said we didn't ask for bread.Should we need ask? I came this place many times,the waiter always automatically brought  it for us. We didn't know what happen with this rude guy. We will not return here and do not recommend it to anyone who wants good service. No star if I could .

Service is so pathetic. As we sat down our server came and took the order for drinks. She came back with the drinks and took our food orders. We were hungry. We were waiting for the complimentary bread that never came. After while, sitting there clueless, one lady came with our appetizers. She was so fast, that the moment we realized we didn't have plates, she had already gone. Again we waited for our server to show up. Even though our food was there in front of us, we couldn't eat it. Finally after a while she showed up, we asked for plates. When she went to get plates, I opened the cutlery from the paper towel and what did I see, a dirty fork. I was losing it. The place was not even full, I don't know what she was busy with. She came back, while I told her about the fork, my husband realized she got us dirty plates . Really??? He was quick in letting her know, coz God knows when she will be back. She came back with cutleries and plates. At that time she bothered to ask us, do u want th complimentary bread??? We were so busy digging inc we just nodded as we were not sure. Then came our pizza, the main course, but the complimentary bread appetizers were no where in the picture. Finally she got them, but we couldn't eat it, as we were already eating our ordered food. The important thing is we were really pissed off with the way the service was there.

This was my first time at a California Pizza Kitchen and I was impressed! The pizza was very good (got the meatiest version we could) and we also ordered a salad to balance out the meal, which was also very good! They had a pretty good drink selection and my fiancée really enjoyed her sangria flight. I enjoyed a Chimay Blue and it was great to see that on the menu. I would definitely come back to a California Pizza Kitchen again!
We've been to CPK, in our city of Fort Lauderdale (here in Boston on vacation)!! The food was great and our server named Victor was very pleasant!!

Not too shabby but nothing to write home about. Service was average and they were pretty busy. I never got a refill on my drink. The salad I had was BBQ chopped chicken and that was pretty fresh.  If you are going on a duck tour it's very convenient to grab lunch before or after the tour without worrying about being late.

Stopped by CPK for dinner on Saturday night. It was busy, but our wait wasn't too long and our server was awesome. Our food and drinks came quickly after we ordered them. There could've been a little more sauce on the pizza, especially considering I ordered mine without any cheese, but overall it was a pleasant experience.

Horrible service.  I was on my own and walked over to grab a bite as the restaurant appeared to be quiet and seemed to have space .  When the receptionist came to seat me she asked if I wanted to sit at the counter.  When I told her that I preferred a table she told me that I would have to wait as they had no available tables.  I questioned this because I saw many available tables and there was no one waiting but she insisted that I would have to wait despite this.  Needless to say , I couldn't leave fast enough .  Now that I have seen the other reviews on their poor service I'm sooo glad that I did.

Have you ever gone to a restaurant and suddenly craved Chipotle? Luckily for you, CPK has the Chipotle Pizza! Beans, tomatoes, peppers, onions, and the sauce, it's as if instead of putting those things in a burrito, you just placed them on top of a pizza pie crust. If I'm in a group I always get it as one of the pizzas, since you can still try the other ones that others in the group want to try. The other two that we got were the California Club Pizza and the Thai Chicken Pizza. The Club is like a salad on a pizza; loved the big slices of avocado that were placed on top. I couldn't tell what kind of sauce/dressing was used. The Thai Chicken is alright, it makes the pizza a little soggy though so I wasn't a fan of that.

I've been to plenty of CPKs and you can never go wrong with any of the pizzas here. I usually tend to stick to the tostada pizza which is exactly what I got at this one. Service was a little slow though which is why I give this place 3 stars rather than 4. If you're visiting Boston I'd suggest going to something other than a chain restaurant but the location of this is convenient as it's attached to the Marriott and you don't have to leave the building to get here.

Stopped here for dinner with the family and had a great meal. Restaurant is clean and waitress was attentive and friendly.  I had a great spring roll appetizer and some homemade wontons with a ginger sesame type sauce on it. Very satisfying and tasty. The only downside was the bathroom was not too clean. Used paper towels on the sink and floor and dirty floor and mirror.  Everything else was satisfactory and timely. They do have pizzas cooked in the brick oven and thin crust available as well as gluten free pizzas available.  I would return here for another meal.

As far as theme restaurants go, CPK is one of the better ones. It is very conveniently located inside the mall. The service was good and the pizza was very good. We had: BBQ chicken pizza Pear and bleu cheese pizza Spagettini  Spinach and artichoke dip Guacamole  Margarita Plain pizza We were satisfied with our food and the price. The bathrooms were also clean.

My daughter loves this chain restaurant so I am giving it a four star rating. To me the food is okay, I would rather stick with a mom & pop place when it comes to choosing restaurants to eat at. The service was quick and the waiter was nice, didn't have to wait long to get our food.

The Moroccan Salad was not worth $16. The photo looked better than it tastes. The almonds looked like peanuts...maybe they were bleached baby almonds. But they tasted like peanuts. There was maybe 4 pieces of sliced chicken breast. Disappointing especially when the word chicken is in the dish's name. Just tasted like chicken with cayenne pepper, nothing special. This salad is easy to throw together at home. Not worth it.

Meh, I've REALLY experienced better at this place but last nights dinner was pathetic. I come here frequently with clients and coworkers and I have never had a problem until I came last night with my cousins.   It was NOT the food, I repeat.. NOT THE FOOD! It was the Service!!! Our waitress was horrible and she was just not with it. We were seated and we ordered some drinks but said we were expecting one more person and we wanted to wait. She took our drink orders but it took her about 15 minutes to bring us the drinks. When she finally came back she just dropped off our waters and left. We figured since our friend was running late, we would start off with an appetizer to snack on. So she finally came back again and took our orders. I ordered for my friend who was running late and myself then my cousins ordered their meals.  Our food came and it was delicious of course! I did want a refill on my water but it took her a while to come and see if... A. How our food was.. B. Can she get us anythign else.. When my friend finally arrived, our waitress did not even come to ask her if she wanted a drink or anything. Oh wait, she did after she finished her meal and was very quick to ask if we wanted dessert.  The last thing that irritated me about this experience was that when I first ordered my meal, I said I wanted to Avocado instead of the CHICKEN on my pizza since I am a vegeterian and I verified that it was STILL an equal exchange and she said YES to me. Well she charged me an additional $5.00 for avocado but when I pointed this mistake out to her she got defensive and questioned me. Again, 10 minutes later she finally came back with the corrected bill and apologized.  I will still come to CPK because I love the food and I always have good service but last night was not impressive at all.

Hubby and I brought the kids here for a late lunch before getting on a Duck Boat. Neither the hostess nor our waitress were friendly. The free bread and oil were very good. We ordered the hummus app which came with pita bread (yummy) and hummus with a bunch of diced tomatoes on top which made the hummus SUPER watery, to the point that we ended up only eating the pita bread and not the hummus. Hubby and I split the BBQ chicken pizza which was fine - nothing to write home about. Kids got mac and cheese and a cheese pizza, which they seemed to like. On a non-food note, the women's bathroom was nasty. I didn't dare enter two out of three stalls because they were so dirty, and the third had no toilet paper. The trash barrel was overflowing. It really grosses me out to see stuff like that at a restaurant. I won't be going back to that CPK again.

Quick, friendly service, late on a busy weeknight. The place looked pack but we were seated right away. We ordered an appetizer and 3 pizzas, all of which were delicious. Our group enjoyed our meal very much.

This used to be one of my favorites to go to until the last year. The last two times I've had the Thai chicken pizza there has been at least a piece of bacon on a slice. I love chicken but do not eat bacon. Last night I had postmates deliver from here and there was bacon yet again as well as a few other toppings that ended up on the pizza. When I'm paying $14 and up for a pizza I expect that not to happen. It is very careless. I found the chicken taste and quality to be different too. There are much better options available in Boston.

Avoid this place at all cost!  This is NOT up to the standards of a typical California Pizza Kitchen.  The pizzas are like old cardboards, the toppings are not fresh;  in fact, one of the pizzas we had, had CANNED pineapples!  The place is dirty with napkins and food dropped left on the floor, and with the associates just ignoring them and literally just walking by them or stepping on them!  Avoid this place!  They should at least change their name and not bring down the reputation of the other California Pizza Kitchens.  I gave it a one star only because it's the lowest rating allowed.

+ nice ambiance + easy to get to, right on the corner of the Prudential mall and across the street from the grocery store if you need that after/before + wait is fairly short for the food Came here for a friend's birthday and they were able to accommodate about 10 of us without any problems. Service was pretty fast and we brought our own cake which they cut and served for us. The food menu has changed a lot since coming here a few years ago---what happened to the chicken garlic pizza CPK?!? I found their food to be OKAY, not bad at all, but nothing where I'd specifically crave on a given day. Anyway, the portions are pretty good, I was able to make some left overs for the future meals of tomorrow and everyone had a good time. Service was a little slow, but there were a lot of us so that might've been on us and all the staff were friendly and accommodating to our large group. It's within reach from the end of the Prudential mall which makes it easy to get to from anywhere on the T/bus lines or if your legs just get tired from walking. A good spot for a basic meal when I'm in the neighborhood, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.

As usual, quality food, quality service, quality beverages. If it were possible, I would give 4.5 star rating. Many options to eat and drink. Would definilety recomend. It is usually busy so I would recommend making a reservation or coming a little early, if not you may have to wait 15-20 min which isn't too bad.

Horrible service. I have ordered delivery from them twice and once I got ice cold pizza, the other time no food at all! It shouldn't take several hours to get an order out to a location less than five miles away.  Have eaten there in person once. Food is mediocre, even worse than other CPK's.

Kid friendly chain restaurant. Nothing bad here. But nothing all that exciting either. Chicken dumplings use bottled sauce. Beats the food court and is a reasonable choice for a meal while shopping at the prudential mall

I like this place. The food was gorgeous! We've ordered Cedar Plank Salmon and Chicken Milanese. The combination of fish and white corn or chicken with arugula was sooo incredible!  We were fond of this meal!  BUT there is a caveat (or downside): for man, I think, the portion will be only to have a snack. He will be hungry in 20 minutes after having a meal. (IMHO)

Short and sweet: Service was terrible. Took forever, even to get water. Avocado spring rolls were OK, not up to standard. Tortilla soup lacked salt, bland, all around bad Straeberry shortcake was a joke. I can give this place anything more than 1 star for convenience of location, Suck my waaaaaaaang

Place I will never eat at again. Rubbery cold chicken on bbq chicken salad. Tasted rubbery ass-like. Brought me small when ordered full. Asked to replace and bright back the small on a larger plate. He said he could get me hot chicken but I didn't have time. 15 dollars for a small salad with maybe a 1/3 of a small chicken breast cooked days ago.  He would have made it right but I hate bitching so much.  Of course this place is know for the pizza. My mistake.

Tostada on the original whole wheat crust is my go to dish here and it's consistently  good. The reason for the 3 star ranking is the spotty service. The servers while polite, often mess up custom orders or the wait for the food is interminable (or both).

Take Away: Horrible service I want to start off by saying I LOVE CPK and I have also worked in every position of the restaurant world(minus the cook) for multiple years and have never seen anything like this. I used to go to the one downtown where the food was always great and the service was as well, but once that got shut down I began going to the one at the Prudential center. BIG MISTAKE! I have gone to this location twice and the service has been constantly terrible.  One my first visit we were not greeted for over 10 minutes by a server and we then had to track down the hostess to a get a server where she told us that she was unaware of who our server was and walked away. we then tracked down the manager who got just grabbed someone and told them that they were our server. The entire time he served us he kept asking that we nit write a bad review and when we left the manager asked us to write a nice review. I found that to be very unprofessional and uncomfortable.However my worst experience was one my 2nd and last time at this location. I was planning to celebrate my boyfriends birthday there with some friend. I called first and asked if I could bring a cake in and then come back because it was a surprise. When I delivered the cake the host seemed very annoyed that she had to walk the 2 feet to put t in the freezer and the guy doing take out window seemed even more peeved to put it in the freezer. On that note I asked for it to stay out as it had to defrost and that I would be back with my party in a hour. When we returned to eat I noticed the cake was not out so I once again asked the hostess to make sure that the cake was taken out so it could defrost and if she could ask our server to bring it at the end of the meal. After waiting 15 minutes for our server who was exceptionally slow and also seemed to be annoyed when we asked for water with lemon (she blatantly rolled her eyes)we ordered. Towards the end of the meal I was already a bit annoyed by the service, she was slow, and never refilled our glasses. I asked her if she could bring out the cake ad she said that she assumed I and the hostess would bring it out although I specifically gave it to the restaurant so my server could bring it, I went back to the hostess stand to ask about the cake. Although it had only been 1 hour she seemed to not remember me nor the cake and told me that she didnt know if it was taken out and that I should ask the guy at take out. When I went over to ask him he also seemed confused and told me he forgot to take it out. At that point I was so annoyed I went and spoke with the manager who was less than helpful as he just told me to sit and wait.After waiting ANOTHER 10 minutes I asked for the check and to just take my still frozen cake home with me, It was the worst CPK experience I have ever had and I will never go back, nor will the people in my party. I really wish that this location had been closed as it offers nothing but slow service and an exceptionally incompetent and horrible customer service. I wish I could give it less than a star.

My first time dinning at this location was okay. We had a BBQ chicken pizza, and a split Thai crunch salad. I wasn't a fan of the pizza, but I did fell in love with the Thai crunch salad. My friend and I even made it at home the next day because I wanted to try to make it, and of course, eat it. Since I love the salad, I do recommend it.

We came here at 5pm. Tired and hungry. 80% of the tables was empty, 75 % off them was still dirty after previous customers. Good thing, they were busy and probably serve good food( it was my first though) bad thing they got too tired after the rush hour to clean the tables.  My wild mushrooms  pizza was decent ( I didn't like sweet dough) but veggie California was much better!  We paid for 2 pizzas 30$

Decided to stop in at this location and have the BBQ pizza.  It's OK.  Waitstaff is OK.  Nothing stands out here.  Due to the mall location, you get a lot of teenybopper kids there.  Service is fast enough and I would go there again.

food is decent, but they always try to charge more than they should. the kids meal was a comp when i get an adult entree, i told them over the phone yet they charged us full price.  an app was comp also when i signed up for their rewards prog and they tried to charge that too. bothersome.

I have been a fan of CPK for years. I usually went to the location in the transportation building but it apparently closed. Since my friend & I had already decided to eat at CPK we made the trek to the Pru. They have added some items to the their menu which is nice since it adds some variety to their already broad menu. There are certain things I am a fan of & hope they never change. The margarita spring rolls are a must & a good appetizer to share. When it's cold out I like the pea soup because it's super filling & tasty. They always have a great variety of salads which is really great during the hot summer months. Although this is a chain they have good quality items & that makes a difference & also keeps me coming back.

What has happened to this place!?  Had the wild mushroom pizza here last night. It used to be one of my all time favorite pizzas. This time however, it was completely different from what I remember; they really skimped on the toppings to a point where they only covered the very center of the pizza. Once I finished, the only taste left in my mouth was that of dough and salt. I also believe that this pizza used to come with truffle oil, which contributed to the deliciousness. This is now an optional item (extra $$). I usually get it with chicken (extra $$) and even the texture of the little chicken that was on there was different. the pieces were completely cold too. I really hope that these changes are limited to this location only and were not a change as part of a corporate initiative to reduce cost/increase profit margins on their pizzas. If this is how every location serves their pizzas now, I will not keep going back. The only reason this was not a 1 star experience is because to the friendly service.
Really great place. For two people I recommend two cup of farmers market soup and pizza. Be careful with Sicilian pizza - it's hot and spicy. And don't forget to order Sam Adams, it's just great.

I've always been a fan of CPK, ever since I was a little kid. When i moved to Boston I was super excited that they had one in the Pru. I've been to that location a bunch and every time there is a super long wait. Being that it's in the location that it is, there is a lot of visitor and pedestrian traffic from the mall along with all the people staying in the nearby hotels. Thankfully the wait is never as long as Cheesecake Factory. That being said, they always manage to get my order mixed up. The waitstaff are friendly but depending on the time of day, aren't the most attentive. My pasta is always watered down and my hummus always has wayyyy too much garlic.  I'll pass

I enjoy the food at CPK typically. This past visit I had, the food took the better part of 45 minutes to be brought out (which would have been more understandable had it been busier). Our server perpetually disappeared for long periods of time as well. We didn't see her from the time the food arrived until we were ready for the check.  I'm not really someone who needs much during a meal, perhaps just a refill, but our server legitimately disappeared for over 30 minutes. When we finally flagged her down, we asked for the check, which took her another 10 minutes to bring to us, and then another 10 minutes to cash out. Again, this would have been understandable had it been busier, but it was not terribly crowded. I would go back to CPK in the future, but perhaps not this location.

Okay, so this place looks nice upon entry. Physically it is nice, but hopefully you don't get the host who would obviously be somewhere doing something (someone?) else. Our host was completely ignorant. Also, chairs seemed to be thrown haphazardly around the tables. Once our server came, however, things started to turn around. She was warm, friendly, and (possibly most of all) patient (I couldn't make up my mind on what pizza to get). Amanda was super helpful in mentioning that they can do half-and-half pizzas, for those who want to share two different kinds of toppings, or if you want to try two for yourself. So there we were, happily eating our pizzas, when the house lights suddenly and inexplicably got much brighter.  This was not a temporary failure but something that seemed designed to make people leave. If I wasn't eating, and didn't have another whole bottle of Newcastle Brown Ale to drink, I certainly would have left pretty quickly. Lucky for them I was enjoying my food (I had a 50/50 Hawaiian chicken and pepperoni, both of which were super tasty). Overall I would say go ahead and check this place out. Don't expect to be wowed by the front desk "service", but the food should be pretty good. They may also suddenly turn up the lights on you.

I stop in here for a snack at least once a week as I work nearby; often times its take out however I do done in as well. Can't go wrong sitting at the bar as the service is fast and friendly. On my recent trip in they seemed to be having an off day (no one at the take out area, bar tender too busy to take an order, and front desk too busy talking to wait staff to even say hello) so after a 10 min wait with multiple opportunities to be spoken too, I was just going to leave when I thought if I ran the place I'd want the feedback... The GM Adam Arzoomanian was kind and courteous and appeared sincere in wanting the honest feedback. He grabbed me my snack in under five minutes, free of charge, and it was the best it has ever tasted (I got the feeling he whipped it up for me fresh himself) can't beat the yummy food here and a manager that cares to improve!

We ordered takeout from CPK while staying at a local hotel. We weren't extremely hungry so we ordered the Unordinary Cheese Pizza and Hummus and Flat Bread. My husband ran out to get it as it was right around the corner from our hotel.  We ordered online and it said the order would be ready in 15 minutes. He arrived on time and was told the order was not ready...he mentioned the restaurant wasn't all that busy, yet our online order was a half hour late.  (To put in context out order was to be ready at approx 9:30pm, hardly dinner rush hour).  The order must've been sitting there because it was cold when he received it and got back to the room.  The food was ok, but the organization of a place with online ordering capability is horrible. Very unfortunate because we were really looking forward to this meal!
Waitress was not attentive, wanted just a water for 20 minutes and she still has not asked if our food is okay ans also the food that arises to our table was not as we expected.
For being a chain restaurant, their pizzas are fantastic! Quick, decent price, reliable. I know you'll be a skeptic, but their salad pizza is to die for, and fairly healthy.

Apparently reservations at this CPK don't mean reservations. Had a reservation at 8pm. At 8:45, we still weren't seated. What's the point of making a reservation? Service wasn't friendly. We were never seated. Poor performance all around.

I got the mushroom pepperoni and sausage pizza. Not impressed, it literally had 4 pieces of sausage and 2 basil leaves. Service was sub par. The co2 wasn't working for the soft beverages, which was disappointing considering it was a Saturday night. Again, not impressed.

This is a good chain pizza place. I ordered the caesar 1/2 size and The Works pizza. My husband and I split which was just enough. The waitress was nice and our food came out fast. I would recommend this place. I would imagine it might be busier during prime eating times. We came for a later dinner at 8:30.

We went to CPK this Saturday (weekend before Marathon Monday) and were able to snag a 4 person table in about 5-10 minutes.  We were impressed.  The mall was packed and we were happy to be able to find a place to have a sit down lunch.  Service was great, attentive but not annoying.  Food came out fast and hot.  One of the waitstaff was happy to take a photo of us without making a "face." Always happy about that.  A and I had the caramelized peach salad (half size) and the veggie pizza, both were yummy, not out of this world delicious, but totally acceptable for mall food.  We weren't looking for gourmet, just something a little better than the regular food court.  Bill was about $30 for the two of us for lunch, which we thought was very reasonable.   We'll be back :)

The hosts were inattentive to the point we thought we were supposed to seat ourselves (and observed others having the same experience).  They did seem to have plenty of time to talk to one another though... the waitress was actually worse!  She looked over several times after my husband finished his first drink and never once checked to see if he wanted another.  Although the food is decent, being so thoroughly ignored ruined this visit and I can't see that we will be going back the next time we are in town.
My first time and I'd love to go back! I ordered the roasted veggie salad and a half salad was a huge portion. I also ordered the crispy mac and cheese which I enjoyed.

It's alright. First time ever coming here I had the BBQ chicken pizza and the cheese tasted a little off to me. It wasn't bad but it's not something I'd order again unless there was an option to change the cheese. Then I tried the Garlic Cream pasta with chicken the first time and it was pretty good. Then I got it again and it was not as cheesy as before so it can be a hit and miss unfortunately

Just a great experience but it's a chain, right? And it's in one of the more touristy areas of Boston aka Copley.  Although I generally like CPK, this particular one didn't impress or even satisfy.  The food was okay and the service was quite average.

I have been to other CPK's and this was severely failed to meet the mark. Went in for lunch on a weekday. The mac-n-cheese balls (appetizer) were under-cooked and almost frozen on the inside three times in a row! The fourth time, the manager came out with the plate and they were decent. She was very gracious and offered us another complimentary appetizer of our choice. The customer service was commendable, but the food, not so much.

I came to this location about two times in the past year.  I have ordered two of the pastas and guacamole and mac&cheese balls here. The pastas here aren't anything special. They aren't the best either, mostly on the bland or oily side. The guacamole here is pretty good though. However, for the price you pay, you only get about a mouthful. It was probably 2x the size of the small ketchup cups you get at a fast food restaurant. Not worth it. The fried mac and cheese balls were alright. Nothing great either. The service was decent. Not superb but alright.  I personally wouldn't come back here again.

CPK is always a great way to fill up after a day at the mall, post work, post classes etc. Spacious seating areas inside, CPK accommodates any size parties. As they specialize in their pizza, your orders are also out in a very timely manner. In the past, I have ordered and stuck with the California Club, which is essentially greens/avocado on top of a pizza topped with chicken and bacon. This pizza never disappoints and satisfies both my salad and pizza fixes. :) The staff is always super friendly as well. Also, you can ask for bread and butter/oil after you are seated! (You can also get free re-fills of bread.) Overall, a solid restaurant that fills you up wonderfully -- I usually even take my leftovers home -- tastes just as good the next day.

Mediocre. Like the Yelp star suggestions says: "Meh. I've experienced better."  I'm a fan of their Thai salad, especially with avocado, but this time I decided to try something different. I got the wedge salad appetizer, and the pesto cream penne. They were okay. The wedge salad was very plain, like a Cobb salad in wedge form, but the blue cheese dressing was unimpressive. Not bad, just not particularly good. The pesto cream penne with chicken was more flavorful and creamy, but nothing to write home about. The flavors were simply dull. I might go back on occasion, if other places have a wait, but I wouldn't really recommend this place. They do have good vegetarian options though.

I won't go into details about the menu because CPK's menu doesn't really chance between locations. However- I think this CPK location is the best one I have tried so far. The service is also wonderful at this branch...I've had my share of interesting times with friends at this CPK location and the staff has always been lively and fun. Pick this CPK over the other one on Stuart St...much better experience.

The last CPK I went to was a disaster.  It was at the Cambridgeside Galleria - and I wrote an extremely negative review about that place and uploaded some pictures of just how bad it was.  It went along the lines of: horrible service, bad food, bad portions, etc.  That was 2 years ago.  I haven't had an urge to step into another CPK since then. However, didn't know where to go on the weekend and stepped in here.  Glad to say I was very relieved that this is a NORMAL CPK, with none of the shadiness attached.  The chicken tequila fettucini actually has chicken inside and the pizza actually had toppings on it! haha.   Not asking for much, really. But all in all, solid location with actually very friendly staff, quick service, and good sized portions

Pizzas are fairly tasty and reasonably priced, though I can't say the same for their appetizers.  I was here for dinner for a friend's birthday last week and our waiter really could work on his etiquette.  He was trying to take our orders and actually muttered, "Jesus Christ, am I talking to myself here?" loud enough for several of our party to hear...  Clearly, service can be seriously hit or miss and it was very much the latter that night. I did like the lower priced half pours on the wines though.

We love this place! We are foodies but this is a nice option right in the mall. Service is always friendly & food is good. Most of all & the reason I continue to come back is its clean. We've eaten in other establishments in that vicinity @ similar price points & I find those not as clean & mildly chaotic.

This CPK is right in the Prudential Center mall, which means that I order it a lot for my company's group lunches. In terms of catered lunch prep, they do a great job. When I order online, they show an estimated completion time which they usually meet. However, the food itself is mediocre. The pizzas are $10-15, but are really personal sized. You could get a much better pizza from Upper Crust or Figs for about $20 that feeds 2-3 people. The Habanero Carnitas and Jamaican Jerk pizzas are good, but the others are mediocre at best (I've actually tried them all). The field greens salad is tasty, but this is a pizza restaurant and I hope for better. If you must eat pizza in Back Bay, try Pizzeria Regina. So 2 stars for the food and value, +1 star for good catering service.

Great pizza, gfast service, perfect portions, all booths seating which is great. Great locations.  I love pizza and this place has great pizza. I loved the boss per,  Bleu cheese, & sage pizza and the Jamaican jerk chicken pizza. Soo good. Definitely recommend it for great pizza.

My fiancé and I decided to try this place on our day trip into Boston. Overall the experience was pretty good. The prices of the food were reasonable, I ordered a "California club sand which" for $12 which came with a side salad. The sandwich and salad were both good. Another plus was the unlimited refill on the strawberry lemonade which was delicious, but very sweet. Our server was friendly and attentive, and the atmosphere was casual.  The appetizer we got was focaccia bread with oil for $3 which wasn't bad. We spent $30 on a lunch in Boston for 2 people, that's not too bad in my opinion. The reason for 3 stars is that this place didn't blow me away or make me feel like I HAVE to come back, but I would recommend it and may go back in the future.

Solid.  Pretty good service for a rather large party (6), decent prices ($17 or so per person, with drink) and a range of options on the menu from smaller appetizers to sandwiches and pasta to individual sized pizzas.   I had the California Club sandwich and enjoyed it -- the ingredients didn't taste like they were just thawed out, and the herb-cheese focaccia bread was crunchy and tasty.  Also, the ambiance is what you'd expect from a chain at the Pru, tastefully decorated and dimly lit. CPK is right on par with the rest of the chain restaurant fare at the Pru (Legal, PF Chang's, Cheesecake Factory), so it's certainly not a bad decision to stop in if you're looking for a meal after you're done shopping.
Very nice place, very quiet,easy to get to, went there with friends and our jambalaya pasta was to die for...but poor service.

Well i read reviews both bad and good but went for it anyway.  I am staying at the Copley Square Hotel and this location was the closest for food. I ordered online for pickup, when i got there 20 min later all my food was ready to go, the pickup counter employee was very pleasant to deal with and off i went.  My complaints, for the money the portion was horrible on the salad.  It cost $10 and is more like a mcdonalds side salad.  On top of that, they forgot to put the dressing in the bag, my fault for not checking when i picked it up i guess.  While in CPK i did over hear a group complaining about the rudeness of the hostess who was seating the and about how long it was taking even though multiple tables were open.  The pizza was excellent that i ordered but other then that i wouldnt return to this location, doesnt seem to organized.

I really was upset when I went here because I wanted Pour House nachos, but CPK went above and beyond and I had a great meal. I went with a large group on a Thursday night. We had call ahead and we got seated when we all arrived. Our waiter was attentive and friendly. He even agreed to swipe 4 cards for us at the end of the meal (sorryyyyy). We ordered five pizzas to share and there were so many amazing options. I had the Tostado and Shrimp Scampi (just slices, not the whole things). I love the mexican pizza at Bar Louie and the Tostado here was just as good! The Shrimp Scampi had little baby shrimp which were yummy. We also had a Greek, Jamaican Jerk, and another Tostado and everyone was happy! We were worried we might not have enough pizza for 8 people and planned to order more but 5 was plenty. It made it really affordable but there were no leftovers. I was pleasantly surprised here and I would definitely bring a group back. Also, if you sit in the back corner near the window, the table rumbles when the t goes by. Interesting....

Yummy, and pretty good for a chain location. I had the five cheese and tomato pizza, which was delicious and moderately priced (I think it was 11 or 12 dollars at most). A person with a normal appetite would have had plenty to take home for leftovers, but I was so hungry that I finished it all in one sitting! My "cranberry cooler" drink was bottomless, which impressed me-- most restaurants don't do free refills on non-fountain beverages.  Good service and atmosphere. We enjoyed eating out on the restaurant's terrace.

Not gluten friendly, BUT their salads are certainly doable.  Visited this weekend with life long friends and ordered the chicken waldorf salad and it was GREAT - nice greens, nice chicken, lemon dressing which was light and on the side.  Easy to get to from the Prudential, plenty of seating, we had good service.  Did notice that the chicken garlic pizza was not on the menu that Id enjoyed in previous years????

Came in here to get take out one night after work.  I walked in to the take out area and no one was there, so the hostess told me to go to the bar.  I picked up a menu and sat...and sat...and sat.  I believe it was the manager who finally approached me and asked if everything was fine, and I told him I needed to place a take out order.  He waved to a guy behind the bar who came over.  I had a coupon in my email for 20% off my order if I included a slice of pumpkin cheesecake in my order.  Sure, no problem. I ordered a piece of cheesecake and a spinach artichoke pizza with honey wheat crust.  I waited for about 20 minutes and swatted at some fruit flies while I waited.  Side note observation:  their "bar" is pitiful.  About 15 bottles of bottom shelf liquor.  I'm not sure how many different drinks that can make, but when they're lined up on the ledge above the pizza prep table, I'm not impressed.  Liquor deserves special treatment. My pizza and cheesecake finally arrived, and so did my bill.  No discount.  So I had to wave down the manager, who made a slight deal about it, until he corrected my tab.   When I got home, the pizza wasn't on the honey whole wheat crust, but whatever.  I had a couple pieces and then went to take a few bites of the cheesecake.  Brrr.  The cheesecake was still frozen.  Not only did it survive transit on top of the pizza as I brought it home, but it sat in the apartment for approximately 20 more minutes as I ate my pizza.  Still frozen?  Pitiful.  I'll get my CPK from my local Shaw's from now on, thanks.
