Oh.My.So.Good. went here with my best friend a couple of hours ago. it was legit mindddddd blooowwwing. like i love their pizzas. like a lot. i had the thai chicken pizza, which's like the best thing I've ever had. i love the bean sprouts on top, but they should consider putting a little salt in their peanut sauce. oh yeah, we also had the korean bbq steak tacos and the dumplings for appetizers. I DONT KNOW WHY IM ADDICTED TO THE SAUCE THAT GOES WITHT THE DUMPLINGS. absolutely divine.
I love CPK. This location was predictably good.

I can't put this off any more. I like CPK.  I don't care that they're junk food disguised as fresh gourmet pizza. .whatever.  It's junk food.  It makes you fat, in increases your level of heart attacks, it does a number on your skin.  It's bad for you. . . and yes. . . I kinda like it. It's not brilliant.  It's not inspired.  In fact, it's no . . . . average, that for all these years I've never reviewed them.  Still, when you want 50 different options for pizza and don't want to listen to sully ramble on about the pats, this is the place to come.

Stopped by here during a business trip and thoroughly enjoyed it. This particular restaurant is part of a local mall and if you are staying in the Marriott nearby, it isn't necessary to go outside. There is a walkway connecting the hotel with the mall. I think this is a nice little feature if you happen to be visiting Boston in the winter,LOL. I had the Jamaican Jerk Pizza and it was really good. The spices gave the pizza a little bit of a kick the crust was the thin variety, which I have disliked in the past yet find myself liking more and more lately. The wife had a BBQ Chicken with Applewood Smoked Bacon Pizza and that was pretty dang good too.  I really like the menu at CPK, they have an pretty eclectic mix of pizzas that you can choose from. The overall quality of the food was good and I didn't think the price was out of line for what we received. The customer service was very good also. Our server came by and checked on us several times and we were greeted at the door by a very friendly hostess when we came in as well. This wasn't the first CPK that I have been to although it may have been the best one.

I decided to order from CPK today because I received a gift card from a vendor for their restaurant.  I ordered the Veggie sandwich and the tortilla soup.  The soup was actually pretty good - and they remembered to put the tortilla strips on the side!  However, I am surprised that they didn't notice when they were cutting my sandwich in half that it was literally ROCK HARD!!  I tried to bite into it before I realized and cut the roof of my mouth so bad.  I tried to physically break the bread with my hands and I couldn't - it was that HARD!  I brought it back and they made me a new one... but cmon - how did that go unnoticed???  They also did forget to put bread in my order, which I specifically wrote out in my receipt.  I got the bread, I got a new sandwich, but it was completely unnecessary and could have been avoided if they had better quality control.  Needless to say, I probably won't be going back here again.  Some say they have good pizza, but I'll take my chances elsewhere...
They're chicken lettuce wraps are the best I've ever eaten.
Good, but not fresh, overpriced for food portion size Nice ambience compared to other CPK's, friendly staff. We had garlic chicken pizza and italian salad (half sized)

CPK is pretty average at best. I've had a few different pizzas and they're decent, but nothing special and definitely smaller than you'd expect. Plus, when you have the word PIZZA in your name, you should probably be better than decent. Service is ok as well. The last time I got takeout - there wasn't even anyone at the takeout register and I ended up having to wait 10 minutes for the bartender to even come over to me.  (as a side note, I still haven't found any pizza in this area that I like - aside from maybe Upper crust - so 2 stars isn't as big of an insult as it'd seem!)

Just a regular pizza place.  If you don't want to wait at the cheese cake factory in prudential center, this might be an option.  Even on Saturday night, we only wait 3min.  The food is OK.  Not good, not bad.  Salad was better than pizza.  The little bit sweet crust was not my taste.

Went here for lunch with a group of about 8.  It took forever to get our food, and it came very spaced out so that half of us had our food but waited a while for the other half to get their food.  My salad tasted like it had been sitting out for 4 days - the leaves were wilted and the pear was rubbery and old looking.  This was the second mediocre experience here.

Came here for lunch today and the service was awful. Apparently if you choose to sit outside, they forget to serve you altogether. We had to call the waiter to be served the first time. During our appetizers, they forgot to bring us plates and cutlery. During the main course, the same thing happened again after reminding them for the third time to bring out some plates while our food was getting cold. We had to speak to the manager at the end and he graciously footed the bill, but I would definitely not come here again.

location: San Francisco Bay Area, United States
review: This California pizza kitchen definitely met my expectations when it came to the food.  CPK has always had great food and an atmosphere great for large groups.  I got the BBQ chicken pizza with bacon and it was as a good as I remember.  I definitely recommend that pizza for meet lovers! One thing to keep in mind is that CPK is located in the prudential.  Although it is convenient, it is also convenient for everyone else.  On popular nights such as Fridays, CPK gets extremely crowded and could be up to a half hour wait. Lastly, when I went, I had lower than adequate service.  My waiter seemed disinterested and annoyed.  Maybe it was just because we were a group of college students or maybe just because he had a bad day.  I dont know.  All I know is I expected a lot more from the CPK staff. Overall, it was a good experience I will definitely be going back in the future.

Better interior layout post-renovation but long wait time for food (40 minutes), wrong food delivered (steak tacos instead of fish tacos), cold minestrone soup. Fusilli broccoli was correct. Two requests to get iced tea filled; no pre-emptive offers to refill drinks.  Overall, suffering a bit from the kitchen and inexperienced service. Better to keep people waiting on the table than to seat people you can't serve.

Went here for Veterans Day. Enjoyed a free pizza and soda. Service was friendly, quick and the food is delicious. I recommend you eat here if you are hungry, want quality food and are in a hurry. Fun watching them prepare and cook in their open view kitchen. Thank you for respecting the nation's Veterans!!!

UGhhhhhh... I have loved CPK since I first discovered it in middle school. And then, I come here tonight for dinner and I believe all my CPK mouth-watering fantasies with Tostada pizza (one of my absolute faves!) and portobello mushroom ravioli and apple crisp and all the other goodness have been crushed! Seriously. Food took CENTURIES to come out and I believe we had, by far, one of the most shittttttttiest waitresses ever. She NEVER came by our table to check on us - maybe every 30 minutes or so and just for a second. There were many times our glasses were empty of water or we just had a bunch of empty plates sitting around. Ridiculous. And, she wasn't nice either. Nearly impossible to track her down when we needed her; she'd just disappear! Man... I still like CPK; I just wouldn't come to this location. A quick side note: raspberry lemon drop = pretttttty good.

Never. Ever. never.  Without being too graphic, I instantly got sick after eating there. Not like "Ehh I don't feel well" kind of sick more like "Oh my god I can wait!!!!" kind of sick.  I had been feeling perfectly fine all day and this could not have been a coincidence.  The food was meh. The service was sub par at best. What made me think to go this this establishment you ask? They gave me a coupon and we all know I can pass up free food. I regret this and you will too. Don't let them trick you like they did me.

I would never really choose to go here, but they are easy to order from (online!) and almost never mess up orders for 10-20 people.  The guy who works the takeout counter at lunch time during the week is super nice and prompt, which I appreciate.

I came here a couple of days ago and it was a great experience. The waitress was really friendly.  I expected huge portions because of the price but I got the opposite instead. We ordered The Original BBQ Chicken Pizza, Pesto Cream Penne and Garlic Cream Fettuccine. The food was delicious!!

A Review of California Pizza Kitchen. By Dimitri D. What you can expect from this fine Boston restaurant is pretty good traditional American/Italian food. I came here with my cousins as well as my brother. I had a pepperoni pizza and everyone else ordered varying forms of pasta. The pizza was delicious and very well portioned. I also tried a bite of my brother's spaghetti and meat sauce which was very tasty as well. The woman who served us was helpful and nice but also appeared kinda bored. Maybe she just had a bad day. All-in-all I would recommend this restaurant and would definitely return.

The name may lead you to conclude that the place only sells pizzas, but that's not true. Although it looks like their specialty is Mexican food (which by the way I love), you'll find all sorts of dishes. For some reason they are not in OpenTable and I couldn't make a reservation via Path Talk either. So I called them reserved a table for my birthday and for my surprise there were no reservation when my friends and I arrived. We ended-up getting a table 30 min after, so it wasn't that bad. Things ended well for me, but I would suggest a double check if you need a reservation.

I've been to a whole lot of CPK's in California, but this one in Boston was a pure pleasure. I brought 5 of my work buddies in for lunch and not only was the food awesome, it was valuable for the money. Amanda was the best server I've seen in awhile. She made us feel right at home and served up food really quickly.

Second time here as of yesterday and this is definitely one of my favorite places to eat at. Our service here was amazing last night (shout out to Alberto!) we were seated right away, our drinks came out fast and so did our food. Our food came out before our bread basket came out! The food was great but it really was the service that we received that made my second time around a memorable one. It was a great place to eat after spending the whole day sightseeing in Boston.
Service was poor - It took 15 minutes to even order our drinks.  Food was good and the restaurant was pretty cool. Overall, worth it had the service been up to par.

So very average. I wouldn't choose to return here, but I guess it's a really convenient location... I had the greek pizza and he had the california pizza (without chicken). They weren't bad, just nothing to get excited about. The only reason I was here was because my friend is vegetarian and I'm still not sure where a veggie-friendly place is so I let him choose. He isn't as discerning of an eater as I am (he calls himself a man of simple pleasures and simple tastes) he chose CPK. I was too lazy to suggest an alternative, and I had some errands to run in the area, so I agreed.  Service is SLOW. It didn't even seem too crowded/ busy. We ordered one drink each and those took forever too. Expensive and weak. Sigh, I guess that is to be expected of chain restaurants located so close to tourist traps.

For a pizza kitchen, there are very few options for pizza. I was looking for a standard buffalo chicken pizza and they didn't offer it at all. The guacamole was 10% avocado and 90% corn, cheap business strategy. One of the managers came over while we were talking/ordering to our waitress and interrupted us to tell the waitress a joke, extremely rude. Our wait staff performed an extensive review of me and my date's license to see if we were 21 and asked trick questions (rude) and didn't offer a refill on our drinks. The restaurant was very slow, so I'm unsure why the wait was so long for everything.

Enjoyed an early dinner here, so it wasn't too crowded. We were seated quickly but never given silverware until we asked. The food was okay. I got the Avocado Club Egg Rolls which I've had before at other CPKs. They weren't full of the stuffing and kind of sloppy on the plate. I didn't really mind any of that but when we paid we were supposed to get $10.30 in change but our waitress (She wasn't wearing a name tag so I didn't get her name) just kept the 30 cents and only gave us $10. I know it isn't much money but it was unprofessional that she kept it. Would've given 4 stars but because of her actions it gets 3.
Solid staple... Very decent pizza and decent price in the heart of downtown. I visit a couple of times a year

Ate at this restaurant tonight basically because I had a gift card.  The pizza was pretty good .  The service was not great.  Saw a MOUSE running down the aisle:(.  Told the waiter....not concerned .  Told the manager and she said it is because of the bushes outside.

Came here with a couple of my friends on one of the blizzardy days where everything was closed, and CPK was thankfully open, so we ate here. CPK is CPK -- the food doesn't vary much location to location, just your run of the mill pizza/pasta/etc. I enjoy eating it, but its definitely not worth the prices you pay. When we were here, we were served by this one waitress that tended to avoid eye contact with us : we would raise our hands to flag her down, for sure make eye contact, but she'd never come. Our meal took around 2 hours, one hour probably spent on trying to get her to find her or find another person to help us out. All in all, not much different from any other CPK I've eaten at ... ok food, poor service :(

We came here with our daughter and her friend for lunch. We were told the wait was between 15-20 minutes and were seated in just over 10 - not bad. However, once we were seated it took the server about 10-15 minutes to ask for our drink order and by that time we were ready to order our good.  It took approximately 40 minutes to be served by the time we sat down until the time we got our meal. We went on a Thursday at 1pm - so the lunchtime rush was in full force. It started to slow down about 1:45pm - 2pm. The pizzas we ordered were good, but nothing spectacular. One pizza is definitely enough for 2 people.
I think the reviews I'm reading here are pretty accurate. CK chefs are great throughout; the wait staff are clearly not the strong suite here

The food here was mediocre, not better than any other pizza I've had. But just an average bite to eat. I had the BBQ chicken pizza. It comes with cilantro, red onion, and smoked gouda. Sounds good, but even I believe that I could have made it better. It wasn't the food that bothered me as much as the service, though. Our server barely came to our table. We waited for her to arrive for a while, but then another server came to inform us that our server had left and that she would be taking over. She also proceeded to take a while with our check. If the service were upped a little, I may have given this place 3-4 stars. However, my experience really wasn't fantastic.
Had the KungPao Chicken with Shrimp and it was absolutely amazing and worth the $16. Had the perfect kick and heat. Service was great and gave extra free bread when asked :)

Still not having it with this CPK....I think I'm over it.....I ordered the garlic Alfredo whatever fettuccini and it lacked flavor. Just tasted like fettuccini in a diluted, watered down, greasy, garlic sauce.....not scrumptious at all. BUT AT LEAST THEY REMEMBERED MY BREAD----my hard, stale bread! Yum!

Over an hour wait for take out, when I arrived to pick up food some was not ready. After a brief three minute walk to our hotel all but one pizzas COLD which probably meant they had been done for a while. The uncommon Gluten free pizza was terrible not much cheese and when cold the entire thing tastes like cardboard. CPK you lost us as a customer.
Convenient location! I just found food court of Prudential closed. I stopped here instead^^

Came during a lunch rush with my fam. Took us almost 20 mins to get noticed for drinks. The server was alright. I ordered the steak medium and it came out well done. The manager took my plate and brought it back the same way he picked it up. My moms didn't want me to throw a fit so she told me be grateful since the steak ended up comped even though I wanted a pink steak, not beef jerky. My mom, aunt, and cousins wife are all Korean and I couldn't help but overhear one of the other servers, her name I think is shameika or something to that note make a comment to our server about how all Chinese people are like that. WE ARE KOREAN. Well, I'm half anyway. I don't even know why I'm posting this, I really should take it up with corporate. If one of the servers, Tom wasn't so friendly with his smiles, I swear, this place would've even made Marie's diner look good. And I feel that Marie's diner has the WORST service.  Advice: for the amount of money we paid, the food was great; MINUS the steak. But if you want good food and good service, there's plenty of places by the mall you can really enjoy yourself.

I visited CPK with my wife. There was this waitress "Priya" a very rude person. I asked for water and she gave just one glass of water. I had to ask her to bring another glass of water for my wife. Later, she got us check without asking if we need dessert menu. Not sure what her problem was.

Poor take out service. Ordered from them through Foodler/Dashed; got the wrong order sent. When I called the restaurant, was told to contact Dashed. The manager made no attempt to resolve my problem on his own. Not sure if this is 100% Dashed's responsibility, but it reflects poorly on the restaurant.

I joined this site just to give this restaurant a bad review. We went in with a coupon for a free app. before we realized it had to be used at a different specific location. Oh well, right? We still got an app. ($5 for a big piece of cheesebread) and we ordered two pizzas because we noticed the people next two us each ordered a pizza. Shrimp Scampi Pizza and Sausage and Peppers Pizza....both on Honey Wheat Bread. Olive Garden has better pizza and a better price and they give you free bread and salad with your meal. Service was slow although the restaurant was dead. Don't go here, just save yourself $20 and go eat down the street somewhere else like a real college kid on a budget. I think people go here to spend more money on purpose, because spending any less for pizza would be too pedestrian or something. First and last time I have a craving for trying CPK. Die CPK, just die.  Final damage....$35 after tip for two pizzas, app and waters.

This particular branch restaurant is very conveniently located inside the Copley mall right next to the bridge across Mariott Hotel side. The food is well-controlled and taste about the same as the other branch on Stuart st. between Wang Center and the common.But I find their food taste a bit shallow and very sweet.  What I find awkward is the young diners, who are mainly dressed like they are sitting there dying to be displayed. You will have to see it yourself to find lots of people wearing hats and sunglasses while eating, i.e. Men with tight jeans showing the bulging tummies, girls chatting on the phone till they leave. The next drawback is the waiting service. In general, the food is served extremely slow and it can take 1-1.5 hours to sit and have a quick lunch. I advise that  ordering appetizers definitely slows down the next course.  Personally, we had a bad waitress who did not get us a menu for first 15 min. and the drinks were delivered after another 20 min. And, appetizer was served for another 40 minutes later.  When we were leaving without leaving any tip for her, she confronted us at the door poking my back with the receipt plate. And I had to have a good talk with the manager about the slow service and mostly the rudeness I experienced from that waitress. Whether it was the waitress's negligence or the kitchen forgetting the orders, it was never explained to us and the waitress knew we were not happy, yet still confronting us for not leaving any tip or expediting the service. I stopped going there because of that incident, plus, the menu is barely changed and because the food tastes like take out Chinese cooked with any combination of 5 sauces and 4 different meats. It is not so pleasing diner out place but the location is ideal during the shopping spree in the copley mall, And, the food price is cheap.

I spent the past few days at a conference at the Copley Marriott; stopped here for lunch after browsing their salad menu. I ordered the Miso salad and really enjoyed it; lots of gingery flavor in the dressing, lots of edamame, crunchy noodle bits of some sort.  Service was fine and I made it back to the conference on time.

I was staying at The Mirage when CPK opened in 95 or 96, and I remembered thinking "what a cool place" Sadly, I am thinking" what the heck happened"...The answer is simple when a semi iconic brand expands some of the authenticity dissolves with it.  Like Coors. The restaurant and food are now just average.  To be fair, I had a salad, which was ok.  I have not eaten their signature pizza.  Legendary this place is not....

Nothing spectacular about this chain pizza joint.  Exactly what one would expect:  generic decor, waiters uniformed in a way to make the place seem fancier, a bar.  The food was fine, nothing to get too excited about.  My friend and I split the wild mushroom pizza and the BBQ chicken and applewood smoked bacon pizza.  Both were great, though for me, it's hard to mess both those types of pizza up.  Our waiter was friendly and attentive; he initially brought out the wrong drink for my friend, but almost immediately corrected himself, which earned him major points from me.  Everything was fairly fast and easy.  I wouldn't mind going back.

Normally, I am not a fan of chain restaurants (except Chipotle). However, after taking a break from shopping and devouring the new Cedar Plank Salmon with corn salsa, I had to out myself as a new CPK fan. Sure, this dish is a bit more expensive compared to CPK's standard bland chain restaurant fair, but the cedar plank salmon is both rich with flavor and healthy - the perfect quick meal. Definitely try it the next time you're there and let me know what you think.

The staff here is really nice. I have to give them props, I came in wearing my Yankees shirt and they goofed with me, but provided great service. Apparently, the poor girl who had to serve me lost a game of rock paper scissors as to who would serve the Yankees fan. The outside section is a nice change of pace when it's nice weather. It's next to the mall, but it's not near traffic, so it's pretty secluded to guarantee a nice meal. As I've said in other CPK reviews, have your pizza on the honey wheat crust! YUMMY! Our food was served sorta slowly, but not so slow as to complain. If you're not in a rush, this is great. If you're looking for an in-and-out type deal, try Chili's in the mall across the street in the Marriott.

Not my type of pizza. Overly pretentious, they try too hard with the different types of pizza w/flavors from different continents. The pasta is really starchy and dry, even with sauce on. Wait, in fact, it's gummy. The only thing worth getting here is the salad. One of my all-time favorite salads is their "Original Chopped BBQ Chicken Salad". Shredded romaine, black bean, corn, diced jicama, tortilla chips, sprinkle of cheese and the best garlicky ranch dressing ever! The Asian Chicken salad ain't so bad either.

Ugh, why would you eat at this place with so many better choices in town? Eating pizza with a knife and fork and so much salad on top seems counter to the point of eating pizza for me but if you are looking for a clean sit-down place to take your out-of-town parents and you don't want to expose them to the great unwashed of Boston then this is the place for you. Tablecloths! Waiters! It's even in a mall. Sheesh, why come to Boston if you just want to mall it? Food is actually good for what it is. It just doesn't excite me. Try heading INTO the city for something other than standard fare. Okay, if you just need to fuel the machine but it's just pizza trying to be interesting.

CPK. CPK. What the hell happened? When I first came to Boston, CPK was decent competition for other Pru eateries like Chili's. Now all of a sudden their pizzas are 1/2 the size with 1/2 the toppings. And for nearly double the price (like $13-$14 for a tiny pizza). Are you freaking serious CPK?

I've always thought of CPK as a good chain restaurant. Mostly because of the variety of pizzas and entree salads the menu offers. However, that about speaks for all of it. The service can be spotty, but the food is almost always the same (which is a good thing). It's a good place to rely on in case you're other plans fall through.
subpar pizza. you can find better places in boston for pizza.

I know this is a chain.   I happen to really enjoy the food here.  The atmosphere is fun and casual an upbeat.  Some of my favorite foods-- smoked bacon and gorgongola chopped salad, the thai salad and pretty much all of their burgers, thai linguini and the chipotle chopped salad

Nice pizza ! I had White pizza and my friend had chicken pizza with BBQ sauce. Both were very good ! People who work there were very nice. I could see many people ordered salads so I'd love to try that when I go there again.

I've been here twice recently. I've come to the following conclusion. UNOs is way better and cheaper if you want a chain pizza. You can order online and get 2 flatbreads at UNOs for the price of 1 at CPK. I actually think they are better too. The first time I went to cpk was for lunch and our waiter was terrific. The second time I went was for dinner and our waitress was absolutely terrible. It was apparent she didn't want to be at work or was having a bad day. Management should have cut her.

No. Just, no. When I was visiting my older sister in Boston she took us out to lunch and decided on California Pizza Kitchen. We were seated quickly, and the restaurant was a nice place but the serve was sarcastic and although I suspect he was trying to be funny, failed miserably. We waited quite a bit for our water. Yes, water. And then we ordered some pizza, salad, etc. As I was drinking my water I looked down to see things floating in it. My first thought: Ew, did they wash this glass? Then I saw it. A spider. Floating around. I think it took about five years off my lifespan. My waiter took quite a bit of time to notice my hand in the air, and when I said "there's a spider in my water" he answered "I put it there just for you." Yeah, okay, his tone was just obnoxious.  I will admit the manager was very kind and apologized, she gave us a free appetizer and a bottle of water. Then the water came back with plates, and there was one plate that my sister was able to wipe off a whole load of gunk with her napkin. Hm...do they wash their dishes there? So we got a new one, and our serve admitted we were not having good luck. The food finally came, and my two sisters were sitting across from each other and sharing a salad. My older sister had just put the first bite into her mouth and started chewing when my little sister was like, "Look, a hair!" Sure enough, there was a curly black hair that had come along for the ride. Lovely. I raised my hand once again and waited for the server, whose response was "you're kidding, right?" The manager came back and apologized once again, saying nothing like this had ever happened before. Yeah, right. We left, without eating, at least we didn't have to pay for the food. (Although we would have been extremely angry if we had been expected to.) That experience effectively killed our appetites and any chance that I will ever be returning. I should've just gotten a hot dog.

Though this place can get pretty crowded, their service is excellent, and quick, so wait times are not that long. Their waitstaff are really nice, and pretty, which is always a plus, and the food is good. Not gourmet but good American-Italian cuisine nonetheless.

*My take-out experience* I decided I was going to order some take-out from CPK because my fiance loves this one particular salad there and wanted to do something nice for him for dinner. Big mistake. I ordered the roasted vegetable salad with chicken, a cpk kobb salad, and a meat cravers pizza. I was told it would be prepared in 20 minutes. When I returned in 20 minutes the woman (who was not at the take out window every-time I showed up) told me she was just waiting for the vegetables for the salad.  Another 25 minutes went by until I got my food. 45 minutes later, after ordering, I got a wonderful cobb salad (the only redeemer) , a very cold undercooked pizza, and a roasted vegetable salad that had 4 stips, roughly a quarter of a chicken breast, which was also cold.  So I totally get the up charge at restaurants, BUT that $4 chicken add on could have bought 5 chicken breasts at a grocery store. Honestly, I even photographed it because I thought it was that absurd.  I paid almost $50 for a long wait, cold food, and tiny portions. To say I am disgusted is an understatement and will certainly not return for take-out.
AMAZING! Great service, great food, great experience. Get the avocado club spring roll! You will be craving it for days to come

I really do love their pizza. Yeah yeah I know it's a chain and all but it is really good. I think they have really creative ideas for pizza. Last time I went I got the pear, walnut, and gorgonzola cheese pizza. Despite how odd the ingredients sounded it was SO good. I even went so far as to attempt making it at home (didn't turn out so well). Lots of options to please anyone and the prices are moderate. You usually have a little leftover for lunch the next day or a late night snack.
The Tosdada pizza is so yummy. And drown it in the cholula hot sauce. The bread here is also really good.

CPK is a great place to go for a bite after shopping at the Pru. This chain has consistently great salads (especially the bbq chicken one), inventive pizzas, and good appetizers. The drink portions are generous and it even has acceptable table wines. The portions are not as overwhelming as Cheesecake Factory on the other side of the mall and salads can be ordered in half orders. Me gusta cpk.

Had an enjoyable night here with my girlfriend. We had the potstickers, the habanero pork pizza, and the greek pizza. All three were tasty, and the habanero salsa was super spicy, just how I like it. My girlfriend had a red sangria, and I tried both the top Shelf long island iced tea as well as the strawberry mojito. I liked the iced tea better, as the mojito was a little hard to navigate, I was getting pieces of fruit jammed in my straw every sip. We came here because we had a $25 gift card, and I still think I dropped about $70 after tip. Will return if we are hungry enough to not have the patience to find a cheaper spot

As a former employee I may be a tad biased but I swear this place has the best pizza in the city.  When I worked here I ate four or five cpk meals a week  and never ever got sick of the food!!!  They have tons to choose from; one of a kind pizzas, fresh salads, and hearty pasta dishes.  Best Buys: BBQ Chicken Chop salad, Margarita pizza, chocolate souffle cake.

I think the crust is what makes their pizzas so delicious.  my suggestion to people when going here is to be adventurous when choosing what to eat.  don't just go and get pepperoni or sausage, yea they will be great but you are missing out on the point of California pizza.  always fresh always perfectly prepared I really like this place.  it was one of the first restaurants I went to in Boston as a young boy and now i work close enough that i can go whenever I want.  do not go here however if you have been within 2 weeks.  for some reason for me i don't like it as much when Ive had it a week and a half ago.

As far as chain pizza restaurants go I love California Pizza Kitchen. Service is great. The menu is expansive! If you can't find something to choose from I would be surprised! Lots of vegetarian selections available. Great value for the money especially in a big city like Boston.

ehhhh why do ppl bother with places like this? The food is like eating hot pockets, i'm never glad i ate it afterwards - *hot pockets* good for kids and groups.. thats all i can say positive about it.
I am in love with the chipotle chicken pizza, the barbecue chicken salad and the lettuce wraps. I like them so much I never get anything else.

I feel like a rivalry exists between CPK and Cheesecake Factory.  Well i'm voting for the Pizza Kitchen.  As far as chains go I feel like the offerings haven't been too homogenized, and the portions are big but not excessive and if there is a single star item on the CPK menu it is without a doubt the Asian Slaw.  oh the slaw! super fresh crunchy purple cabbage shredded and tossed with a tangy peanut sauce! I also feel like there's some degree of health consideration on the part of the CPK menu developers. sure you can get fattening food but it feels wholesome.  perhaps i'm just trying to justify eating a whole pizza at a sitting, but when there's fresh avocado on a pizza, well how could i resist?

Pretty good place.  Their pizza is normally good, but the only reason I am not giving it a 4 is that the food is really heavy and I feel huge when I eat the restaurant.  I always either get the mushroom ravioli or the southwest pizza.  There can be a massive wait on weekends, so be warned.  Desserts are pretty great too.  Worth a visit.

My husband loves this place, but I just don't see the draw! I think everything they serve is pretty decent, pricing is fair and the portions are a good size. The service, I must say though, is top notch for a midway restaurant. It is a great place to stop off and eat when you are shopping in the Pru; I enjoy the Sundried Tomato Fusilli Dinner (I add some alfredo sauce for an added kick). Waits are minimal and you get a great window view of shoppers who come out of Saks and Lord & Taylor...

location: Noe Valley, San Francisco, United States
review: I've been to all three boston locations, so i'll just write one for all.  They all seem pretty similar (it is a chain after all) with no difference in service.  though it's a chain, i like it here. they have such a yummy range of different pizzas, which are not all soggy like house of pizza place pizzas are.  i love specialty pizza.  i usually get the vegetarian ones, not cuz i am one, just becuase they taste good. and they have whole wheat honey crust as an option which is good.  get the whole pizza and take the rest home as a snack.

I love California Pizza Kitchen's menu.  There are several delicious pizzas and salads that I can recommend.  However, I rarely have good service at the restaurant in the Prudential Center.  If you can look past that, then enjoy!

Just had lunch with a friend. We ordered the Works Pizza, pesto creme penne, and the spaghetti bolognese. The food was good, but our waiter was slow and inattentive. We waited several minutes just to get our water. He passingly asked us how our food was, and when he came over to get our dishes to go, he only took two 2 out of the 3. My friend initially wanted to take her leftovers. We wanted to get two checks, but before we could ask, he just plopped down the bill and left before we could say anything. Then we waited several minutes to flag him down to ask for a bag. When he finally came over, he just told us to grab a bag at the front. From the other reviews seems like there are some good waiters, but that service is generally lacking here.

Same as the Cambridgeside Galleria location- semi-exotic pizza, West Coast salads, basic American desserts and decor- but a bit bigger.  Window tables provide a nice view if you get bored with the bread and butter before the meal.  Since ideas of "expensive" vary widely, I'd price your average meal there (one entree + shared appetizer) at about $15.

I absolutely adore CPK (yes, I love it so much that I gave it a nickname). Favorites: the spinach and artichoke dip, shrimp scampi pizza, thai chicken pizza, and the caesar salad. If you go with a friend, you can share the spinach dip and a pizza and be set- or, get more and bring home leftovers! This place does take-out as well. Really good prices.
it's been over 12 years since i last ate at CPK (in west l.a) and am still eating  the  Chicken Tequila Fettuccine, Thai Linguini and Chinese Chicken Salad.  methinks it will be  another 12 years...

Nice laid back atmosphere makes it a great place to eat with friends. The service is decent-I've been there when it was really busy and practically empty-decent service whenever. The food-well honestly I  have two favorite pizzas I always order-Jamaican Jerk Chicken Pizza and the Garlic Chicken Pizza-always delish!!  Tasty appetizers-try the avocado [or spinach???-lol] cheese dip-It looks gross  as anything green and cheesy certainly would -but tastes great. The prices are fair- IMO. Overall I highly recommend for group/ friend outings.

fun place to go w/ friends for a casual dinner.  Lots of cool, innovative pizzas,plus the option of a wheat crust (ok, its pizza, probably doesn't matter, but its a good and tasty option).  wait can be long at times, but since its in the pru, you can wander around a bit or people-watch
This is the CPK that is in the Prudential center. I have never been to such an awkward, awful restaurant. The server was just so bad and unprofessional. The service was slow and careless.
This is a chain restaurant with good quality food.  The meal I had had a fresh taste to it.  I enjoyed my meal and will be back.

Review #200, here goes... I was reclining on the couch last night with a hookah and some television (typical night at The Home), lamenting that I was standing at the precipice of a milestone: Yelp Review 200. I had started and stopped a couple reviews that I felt were not worthy, but the truth is, I simply was not inspired. My roommate said he ought to sit down someday and read my reviews, and asked if I had Yelped the CPK that touched my avocado. Gasp! I had not...until now.  It was a crisp spring night, and we had tried to go to multiple Cheesecake Factory locations with no luck-- every restaurant required at least a 45 minute wait, and we were huuung-ry. The solution turned out to be this California Pizza Kitchen, where we were able to be seated at the bar immediately.  Our waitress/bartender seemed moderately ticked that we ordered just a water and a coke, and nothing from the bar. She kind of disdainfully poured our drinks and plopped them down in front of us. We ordered, and whatever pizza I chose was topped with slivers of avocado-- probably the defining reason I chose it. I saw our food come out of the kitchen (I was starving and watching for our food like a hawk), and noticed the pizza lacked avocado. The waitress then proceeded to reach her-- gloveless (!)-- hand into a plastic cube and place the coveted green goodness on top of the pizza...with said ungloved hand! One dropped on the cutting board below, and she made sure not to waste it and added it to my pizza. Gross. I ate the pizza anyway, but when we got glared at for ordering refills on our drinks, that sealed the deal on the service.  The bill arrived and we left a meager tip (under 50 cents, if memory serves) along with a note: "Be nice and you'll get better tips. :( PS- We saw the avocado." Sure, it was mean and vindictive, but oh so true. Looking like you don't want to serve your customers makes them feel like tipping you is optional. Epilogue: Phew, Review 200 has been officially knocked off, no more pressure, woo!
Sadly, CPK is no longer offering GF pizza... going down a star for that move. Salads are still a solid choice, but sometimes a girl just wants to enjoy some pizza with everyone else!

For a CPK it is a pretty nice one.  Conveniently located in the Prudential Center.  Though this makes it quite packed as well, with there usually being a wait.  The downside is they always seem busy, so a waiter can be hard to get a hold of at times. Though the food was delivered fast and correctly.  We never felt hurried to eat and leave even with the crowd.  The pizza they have and the variety is quite impressive and they will have something that everyone should like. If you are looking for a nice sit-down pizza restaurant this is a good choice.

We went last night for a lateish dinner when my parents arrived in town. Wanting something inside the mall (it was POURING) and with quick service, we stopped here and found out it was a 10 minute wait. Pretty good for a Friday night! We got sat really fast and our waiter was awesome - patient, funny, helpful. We ended up sharing the The Original BBQ Chicken Chopped (Chopped lettuce, black beans, sweet corn, jicama, cilantro, basil, crispy corn tortilla strips and Monterey Jack cheese tossed together in herb ranch dressing - we got the balsamic and the ranch on the side. Topped with chopped BBQ chicken breast, diced tomatoes and green onions) and the Chinese Chicken Salad (Shredded Napa cabbage, crisp iceberg and crispy wontons tossed with julienne carrots, red cabbage, green onions, toasted sesame seeds and fresh cilantro in a spicy sweet & sour sesame dressing. Topped with chilled-grilled chicken breast). We liked the BBQ better, but both were great. For our main course, we shared the Roasted Garlic Chicken pizza (Roasted garlic, grilled chicken, Mozzarella cheese, mild onions and Italian parsley with a white wine and garlic-shallot butter sauce) which was quite tasty, but was not as good as the Thin Crust Pepperoni Supremo (Italian Pomodoro sauce with pepperoni, Mozzarella, Parmesan and fresh Mozzarella cheeses. Topped with fresh herbs). This was by far the favorite of the table! We didn't get any bread, but we didn't need it. For 4 people, this was a great meal and we were pretty full after! It is a chain and it may not be as good as some of the more "authentic" pizza places, but we thought it was pretty darn good! Totally hit the spot.
Good service. Too much cheese on pizza though. Crispy Mac n cheese was just ok

The Prudential CPK is a good one, as far as CPKs go.   Be prepared for a looooong line on the weekends when mall traffic brings diners in by the heaping handful.   However, you'll be served rapidly and your food won't disappoint.  I've personally found that the less toppings on your pizza that you order the better, but you will likely be happy with whatever you get.
Great food, at a pretty reasonable price. Me and a couple of friends went here tonight for some food.  I got the CPK Cobb Salad - Great.  I'd recommend it to anyone.

The food here is good.  My only complaint is that they need more vacuums.  Or, parents need to teach their toddlers not to spill crumbs all over the floor. Seriously, there are pizza toppings and croutons all over the floor every time I go.

My family and I visited on a recent busy Friday night. We received excellent service, great pizza,  fresh salads, apps and kids meals. Very pleasantly surprised for a national chain, that seemed beyond the ordinary.

One of my all time not favorite chains. The food here is mediocre when compared to other chain restaurants and I'm not the only one who thinks so. CPK makes the Cheesecake Factory look amazing, in my opinion. CPK serves up the same kind of food, but lacking in quantity and quality. When I eat at Cheesecake Factory, I can get a dish with no starches (a salad, a soup) and leave incredibly full and sometimes, with leftovers! I've ordered burgers and pizzas at CPK and left hungry after eating everything on my plate. Now, their food isn't HORRIBLE, but I'd say in comparison to other chains, they're beat in more ways than one.  Example: Thai Lettuce Wraps: one of my favorite appetizers to order as an entree. Cheesecake? One of those and I can barely inhale. CPK? I need to order an app to eat before my entree comes out. Maybe you're thinking that my stomach was in a different condition on each of those days. You're right, it was. I was hungrier when I went to Cheesecake, but left more satisfied with more money in my pocket. So what do you think of that? Anyways, it's just in my opinion that CPK loses to nearly all chains. I always leave there dissatisfied and still hungry and always wonder where my money goes every time.

I love CPK, there isn't any in Cambridge that I am aware of so when I do go to the CPK in the Prudential Mall is a real treat because the pizza is great. They are a good size as well which is great for me because I normally never get full from a personal size pizza. The menu has everything traditionally expected on a pizza and things you wouldn't expect.  I rec. the Hawaiian pizza because not many places can pull it off well and CPK has done a good job with it. There is usually a wait but nothing unbearable and the servers are very nice.  The last pizza I ordered wasn't bad or anything but it was the apple something something and it had lettuce and mayo and I hate mayo ( I should have read the full description) so I didn't enjoy it but the good thing about going with friends you guys can share.

Good quick service.  Excellent pizza selection.  Okay Pot stickers (What was I expecting from a California pizza joint).  Nothing memorable to say here. Not really a impress your date kinda place, but if you are going for pizza and a movie... Perfect.

I wish I could give my dining experience at this restaurant zero stars. I went to this place for lunch with 5 girlfriends. We were seated quickly and that's when the fun times ended. The waitress though pleasant, did not have her act together. First it took about 10 minutes for us to get waters. Then it took about 3o minutes for the first of our sandwiches/personal pizzas/soup/salads to arrive and there was at least a 15 minute gap between when the first of us and last of us was served our main meal. Also, she must have thought that the word  "tortilla"  sounded like "asparagus" because instead of the warm bowl of Mexican soup I was expected, I was instead presented with an oddly green steaming concoction. Not usually a big deal, but by this point all I could think of was "come on already!". The food itself was not prepared the way we requested it. The kitchen decided that my friend asking for no cheese on her pizza meant that they could still top it with "queso" sauce......I ordered the Tuscan Salad off of the small cravings menu and it was gross. The cannelli  beans were mealy and the dressing tasted like straight flavorless oil. 6 dollars for a cup of untastey veggies? never again.  The tortilla soup(when it finally arrived) was flavorless, and reminded me of cardboard. The closest thing I can compare it to would be slightly cheesy cream of wheat. So yeah, I won't be going back to CPK anytime soon. Lunch Fail.

Saying that you want to come to CPK for good pizza is like saying you want to go to McDonald's for a good burger.  It just doesn't make sense. I admit, I used to like CPK.  They had some good BBQ chicken pizza.  But that was before I knew what good pizza is.  I mean, OK, it's not the worst restaurant at the Pru, but I don't understand why there is always a 3 hour wait for this place.  It's all those damn tourists!  I think they have forgotten that CPK is a chain....or, they KNOW it is a chain and are too scared to go outside of a 1 mile radius from their hotel. The service is ALWAYS slow.  I've been here a handful of times, and every time, I feel like the meal takes 3 hours.  And the servers are kind of clueless.  Basically, at least TRY to walk outside of the Pru in order to get some good food....

I love the pizzas at CPK, and the service is usually very good. This CPK in particular made me laugh until my BBQ chicken pizza nearly came out of my nose. I was sitting at my table with my friend Melis, eating my pizza while she had her soup. Suddenly, out of the corner of my eye, I saw something streak across the floor right past our table. At first I thought it was the glint of someone's jewelry reflecting on my glasses, but when I turned around to look at the gray streak of lighting, it actually turned out to be a mouse. Certainly, that is no laughing matter. A mouse in a restaurant? You may as well have a can of Raid at every table sitting next to the salt & pepper! That mouse had jetted across the floor of a VERY crowded restaurant located in a MALL on a FRIDAY NIGHT. And NO ONE saw it. Serious bravado. I caught the attention of a passing waitress. "I don't mean to cause any alarm or anything," I began to say, "but I just saw something..." "Oh," she cut me off, "Was it the mouse?" I paused for a moment and hissed, "What do you mean THE mouse??" That's right. They knew about the mouse. She told me that they're right above the Green line, and sometimes the mouse turns up... but she assured me that it's harmless and that the kitchen is squeaky clean. At first I was incredulous. I could not fathom this. CPK has a pet mouse! Soon after we left, Melis and I just couldn't stop laughing at the whole thing. I have said nearly nothing about CPK itself, although I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this chain (other than this little mascot they have running around). Their pizzas are great, their salads are awesome, and the venue is always clean. And even though I saw a mouse in this restaurant with my own eyes, I still eat there because the food is just so damn good. Yes, my taste buds may need some fine-tuning, but that's just me. Talk about a brand positioning success - even though there's a mouse in the equation, I still prefer CPK over Pizza Hut. :)

Where to begin, well to start off I have been to this location of California Pizza Kitchen four times before. Previously they've been great.  On Monday night (11/25/08) my brother and I decided to grab some dinner here after shopping. The place wasn't packed at all with empty tables everywhere (half the restaurant was empty).  Yet the hostess told us there would be a 20 minutes wait. We asked for a medium or large booth (not a small one).  We asked nicely what the reason for the wait was (due to the very apparent emptiness) she replied that they only had 3 waiters and were understaffed. We said okay and asked her if we had to wait or if we could go browse the shops and come back in 15 minutes). She said "Yes that's fine but be back in 20 minutes not 15. We found her reply a bit abrasive but ignored it. We came back 20 minutes later and they were packed (every table). Not only that but she said they had a medium booth open but it was just taken and now we would have to wait 30 (more) minutes unless we wanted to take a small both. My brother was rather upset and wanted to leave to go to Cheese Cake Factory but I calmed him down and said let's just take the small booth (I should have trusted his instincts and left). Now to the fun. The small booths at this place, keep in mind my brother and I aren't big guys we're both 5'10" - 5' 11" and are average weight for our height. These small booths were made for stick figures. There's no way to be comfortable in them. Add to that the table can barely hold the plates the serve due to the width. Not only that but the small booth they sat us at was right in middle of the high traffic error and at the mid-height wall next to us we the waiters register/station was there. So while we were chatting/eating we'd constantly have a waiter staring at us from the other side of the mid-height wall next to the booth. Now that we have the bad seating of this restaurant out of the way to the good stuff...not... So we get our appetizer and enjoy it (they have decent food in my opinion).Before we can finish our appetizer our waiter brings out our entrees (huge no no when waiting ones table in my opinion). So we're eating our entrees and we're half way done, then the waiter comes to the table and says having desserts guys? My brother replies "most likely but we're still eating our food" the waiter replied "I'll come back in a few".  We finish our food and the waiter brings us our check. My brother is extremely upset as am I due to the fact that the waiter knew we wanted dessert. So we finally get the waiters attention and ask for the dessert menu. He lives and we start looking over the dessert menu. We know what we're getting and wait for the waiter to come back. As we're waiting from underneath our booth two cockroaches come crawling up the wall. YES that's right cockroaches! I nearly throw up but decided to just up and leave the restaurant. We didn't make a scene my brother waited at the table quietly for the manager. 10 minutes go by and the manager doesn't show. The hostess walks by and says to my brother "Did you enjoy your meal?" He pointed at one of the roaches and she took one of our used napkins and killed one of them (the other had gone somewhere else by that time). The manager told my brother in not so many words 'What can we do to make up for this and keep it quiet?' End result being we got our meal free (which didn't make up for anything to me). I felt bad for everyone eating in that restaurant at that time if they knew surely they'd all leave. Now that I think back on it maybe we should have made a scene out of respect for everyone else.  To end this review that was all of the bad. The good was our waiter was very friendly he just seemed inexperienced. Also the food was decent but makes me sick thinking of the roaches.  I'd like to warn everyone to stay away for this location of California Pizza Kitchen at all costs.

Meh... The food: Decent but not memorable The service: adequate but not commendable The place: clean but not fashionable (college dining hall-ish) The price: fair and reasonable The wait: short and manageable  Coming back? Maybe but not probable

Had a nice Thai Chicken pizza here for lunch today, with great service. I get why people rip CPK. It has gourmet pretensions with chain restaurant cooking. It's not authentic thin crust pizza, whatever. But it's tasty, original, and not too heavy. Unlike Bertucci's, Uno's, and Cheesecake Factory, I don't feel ill afterwards. I would stick to the original sauce/topping combos, though, and avoid regular tomato/meat pizzas - they don't compare well with great traditional pizza restaurants.

I seriously love this place.  I actually usually get the same thing whenever I go, the Thai lettuce wraps and the BLT pizza. I've had lettuce wraps everywhere possible, and these are the best I've had in awhile, they aren't too spicy either.  And even though I know the cheesecake factory gives a bigger portion, these win hands down. And yeah, you have to be brave to order lettuce on a pizza, but trust me its worth the risk.  It tastes exactly like the sandwich, but a whole lot better.

Decent pizza, but unspectacular.  Pizza's are kinda small for the kind of money they charge, $10- 12 for a small  (approx. 10"). Service  was excellent though, food came promptly and drinks were always full.

it's always pack there everytime i go.  i love their pizza, one time i got this beijing duck pizza and i thought i would be taste funny but it tasted great!!!  but dont try  their pasta, i think it's horrible.
